Reviews.Title: “bring your own pillows”
Reviews.Author: MissPerpetualMotion
Reviews.Content: I am not feeling the love at the Hotel De Russie lately. I have been going for 7 years ,mainly because of the location and great garden views (if you are lucky). unfortunately the last 2 times they got our booking wrong and we did not get our favorite garden- facing rooms. This last visit we were in a newer wing, directly facing another wing and looking straight into their rooms. The windows at the Russie only have blackout curtains so if you need some privacy ( like when you are walking around the room undressed ) you have to close either the blackout curtains or the outside shutters which means no more daylight. At nearly 600 euros a night for 2 people one would expect more than a hard foam pillow. Having spent a near sleepless night with a crooked neck we checked into the Ars Hotel right around the corner and for half the price of the Russie we finally had some soft pillows . At the Russie the garden is priceless specially in the warm months, the staff is nice but i do not know if i will come back next time unless i bring my own pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven unlikely to be this nice”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Rome is my favorite city, and this is among my favorite hotels. Well located (take a run in the nearly Villa Borghese), beautifully kept up with large, comfortable rooms (maybe starting to look just slightly dated) and wonderful service everywhere you turn. The included breakfast is delicious (alas, what isn't in Italy?), and the gym is pretty good for Europe. Make sure to meet Alessandra, one of the concierges. She can take care of everything and has spot-on restaurant recommendations; she'll even tell you what to consider ordering. The only caveat is price. For example, if you travel with a few devices, expect to pay $50 a day for your Internet connection... impressive! But when you're in a beautiful hotel is this remarkable city, maybe it doesn't really matter. Look forward to returning...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonVirginia
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel in every way. From the first moment we walked in the staff were friendly & helpful and imediately our whole family relaxed. We had been disappointed in anothe hotel we had pre-booked so were looking for a room for 3 nights over Easter. Despite the Hotel being near fully booked the Reception tema very patiently tried hard to find us the perfect room to accommodate our family (as we have 2 young children). The doorman Daniele was a delight, entertaining the children during this process. All the staff were friendly and the service was superb as you would expect for a 5 star hotel but the thing I noticed the most was how happy the staff all seem and they made our visit a special holiday with their personal touches Rareky have I seen such good service (and we travel a lot!). The hotel is set in beautiful gardens and the restauarnt is set up so you can sit inside or outside to admire the garden. Mario, the restaurant manager, effortlessly arranged our breakfast inside followed by coffee outside in the sun upon request. Finally the Conceirge desk were very professional and when our restaurant of choice was full they booked us into an even better one overlooking the whole of Rome. This is a very special hotel, worth every penny. I can not recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shanstan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Hotel de Russie in one of their Classic Suites with an adjoining bedroom, forming a 2B-suite. The only real negative about this hotel is that it is not quite as extraordinary as its sister property in Berlin, the Hotel de Rome. Russie's location is stellar (more charming location than Hassler) as is the service. The lobby and gardens are serene and gorgeous. Rooms are completely fine though the interior design is a bit staid and charmless compared to what you might imagine at a venerable Italian 5-star hotel. Some things I should give credit for simply because they were so perfect we never noticed them -- great shower, fast WiFi, plenty of readily accessible power outlets, etc. There is noise in the evenings even if your room faces the courtyard but I think that is to be expected given the central location in Rome. It was never bothersome. We never ate at the restaurant except for the breakfast buffet, which was very nice, but the room service food was mediocre. That was probably our biggest disappointment with the hotel. They did lose track of some laundry but to their credit, they were very apologetic and jumped through hoops to quickly track it down and are shipping the item home to us at their expense. Overall, it made for an ideal home for the week.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of beauty and style”
Reviews.Author: LeoGonnie
Reviews.Content: Once again at the Russie and still in love with the place. The garden, the courtyard and the entrance halls are glouriously beautiful and elegant. The decoration,(particularly the Easter flower arrangements, complimenti!) is soothingly suave and the bar and restaurant terrace are just so welcomng and pretty they make you want to linger. Best of all its features is the wonderful staff. Everyone is nice and efficient. My only two criticisms are of the room bathrooms, which are slightly dated and a bit small in some cases,and the breakfast selection which although of the highest quality, is a little too "continental" focusing primarily on bread and pastries and cold cuts and cheeses. Both are still perfectly adequate, though, and do not undermine the sheer bliss of being at the Russie.

Reviews.Title: “best of rome”
Reviews.Author: makelly3
Reviews.Content: this hotel is spectacular. i ate lunch outside at the upstairs restaurant on my first visit to the russie. it was so incredible (both the decor and the food) that i booked a room there on my next visit to room. the hotel is spectacular! my room, while small, was cozy and impeccably furnished. the spa downstairs is wonderful and the service was great! it is in a great location as well...very central. if you have the money to stay here, than this hotel is THE place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Hotel de Russie, and last one!”
Reviews.Author: crazy4nature
Reviews.Content: I am staying at Hotel de Russie as I write this review and find it to be quite disappointing. Rome is a 3 night stop in a long business trip, and I was looking forward to a relaxing five star experience. What a disappointment! I got a double room which is quite small and has a few undesirable features. First, the room is old, and in clear need of upgrade,specially walls and ceiling. I asked for a quiet non-smoking room, I got a room on the 5th floor with plenty of noise from the streets below. Perhaps the rooms facing the courtyard are a better choice. The non-smoking floor might as well be smokers floor as the scent crept up, and this being Rome, everyone smokes everwhere. TV service and phone service were spotty, had a few hours yesterday with neither but did not bother to report it. The amenities are not high quality, and neither is the bed. The turn down service is useless (no chocolate!). Worst of all booked the hotel for its one feature: spa with pool and hot tub. Well, they are closed for renovation and I was not informed of this important detail at the time of booking. The one redeeming quality at this hotel is the staff. Everyone is polite, professional and acommodating, as they should be in a five star hotel. Everything else is overhyped and not in line with the high price. Considering this is the most expensive hotel in Rome, I was expecting the experience to match the price. Sadly, this is not the case. On the bright side, the location is good, the garden is pretty, and the common areas clean and well maintained. In closing, I am not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade, Garden & Location = A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bebe38
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome in this elegant grand hotel, and were generously upgraded to the Popolo Suite, with its extraordinary terrace views over Piazza del Popolo and Roman rooftops. While waiting for our room, we enjoyed a very European lunch al fresco in the refined garden restaurant, which was packed with an international crowd. Love the location, and walked to most major sites, plus super upscale boutique shopping so close. We made extensive use of the concierge, and she didn't disappoint. And the service is the kind where you can run in, drop your shopping bags into their arms, and run out again, to come back later to find your items safely put away in your room. All in all, 5 stars earned.

Reviews.Title: “Bath Washed Away 5th Star”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: When we called to inquire about availability on a popular week we were told that, as usual, they were quite full, so we did not expect to get a primo room, and did not get one. Compounding this problem we arrives to a full house off the early New York flight and were told we would get the first room available. We did, and as we were more interested in napping than waiting chose not to wait for an offered better room. The staff was very accommodating and helpful and of course, breakfasting outside while waiting is very pleasant. The room, which was in the wing over the desk, should have been left with the Russians when Rocco Forte took over the property. The room was big enough, and well furnished but its depressing Bronx-like view was depressingly airspace between buildings. Of course, a view overlooking the courtyard can be noisy. All this was fine but the bathroom was TINY. I had to exhale to fit thru the door and of course there was not space for toiletries of an indigent midget let alone 2 adults, one of whom was a woman. I understand that bathrooms in old buildings are a very difficult problem; bath in design and expense but what disturbed me was no one, realizing that this was so small, put the effort into laying out shelving, towel bars, hook and more shelves as one would expect a 5 Star property should. I ended up emptying the tray by the mini-bar and using it to balance on the sink and provide space to put toiletries. Management knows that they will need to rent this room, not as overflow but as part of their regular room inventory, and knows it is charging fully for it so 5 Star management should spend the time and effort, and a little money designing a solution as to making the space efficient and in keeping with what I expect in a luxury property. Reading on Trip Advisor other reviews other guests appear also to have issue with the baths. I love the De Russie. The staff is so Italian charming; the concierge found us good restaurants and were helpful with our transportation. Sitting in the Jardin is memorable and, for me, the location is perfect. But for me they need to spend some effort on the baths to deserve 5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “what a let down!”
Reviews.Author: Eva-cyprus
Reviews.Content: i was in rome last week and really wanted to treat ourselves with the best that rome had to offer...but hotel de russie was definitly not it! we booked a junior suite and were severely let down. The room was very noisy, no flowers no welcome fruit basket or wine, no 'goodnight' treats, very poor quality toiletteries - remeber that this is a junior suite at a 5* expensive hotel where luxury is what you pay for. The room was very cold, the heating didnt make any differenve - we had to pull out all the extra blankets at night! My feeling is that rocco forte must have been hit by the economic crisis and their clients are paying for it! it was our second time at russie and the last for sure! The concierge is definitly not to be trusted - they failed to make oyr booking, they failed to tell us that we did not have a reservation, they made really poor and average recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GideonSeattle
Reviews.Content: The only serious negative about this hotel is the cost. This is money well-spent if you are into luxury &service. Team is courteous, efficient &friendly. They went out of their way to please us. Broken stuff got repaired fast. Restauent &bar are excellent; ditto room-service breakfast. My wife got a cake, a greeting-card, and flowers for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franlo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in August 2011, the hotel is amazing and in a brilliant location....a few downsides - we were obviously there over a very busy weekend and our room wasn't ready when we checked in and although they took us to the bar for a complimentary drink I'm sure they then forgot about us as we had to go back to reception to chase up our room. Standard rooms are not very large. Breakfast buffet was excellent although they have a problem with birds everywhere. Spa and pool was very nice. I wouldn't stay again as I'm sure there is anther option in Rome which isn't quite as expensive and you get a more personal service.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: like2travelNY
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the DeRussie. Loved the room-we had a studio room and it was spacious and lovely. The staff is what makes the DeRussie so special (and the art work) We had some trouble with our rental car delivery and the concierge made sure we were take care of and calmed me down when I was livid with Auto Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for the noise”
Reviews.Author: Susan8552
Reviews.Content: We love the Rocco Forte chain and this property had many of the hallmarks of the group, particularly the beautifully designed rooms and good facilities. However, we were left feeling that this was our least successful experience in one of their hotels. Let's start with the good things - the property is lovely with an interior courtyard and spacious public rooms. The courtyard area would have been great in the summer - we were staying here in mid-winter so couldn't use it. The location is perfect for those who want to take advantage of Rome's shopping and it's close to a metro station for those who want to explore Rome more widely. But in some important ways it disappointed us. The service, always so sleek and subtle in other Rocco Forte properties, was here noisy and brash, with excessive and loud name-checking of guests. (They must have a policy on this, as it is included in their guest questionnaire.) For example, over breakfast to be asked every 5 minutes "Signora X is everything OK?" was a bit trying. The service in the bar was a bit peremptory - we had a sandwich lunch here on one day and weren't made to feel welcome - they actually made us move tables as the one we picked they had earmarked for someone else! And 50 Euros for two sandwiches and soft drinks is my idea of seriously expensive. The other major downside of this hotel is the noise - our rooms were on the third floor but we could hear the music from the bar throughout the day and evening - how is that even possible? The music at breakfast was also at top volume. We were here for New Year's Eve and the downside of the location became clear. The hotel is adjacent to the Piazza del Popolo and this is where the serious firecracker action takes place from 11 onwards - and after midnight the place went crazy. So this is not the place for you if you want a quiet restful stay. On balance, this is still a fantastic chain of hotels, just that the Hotel de Russie is our least favourite.

Reviews.Title: “A magical Place”
Reviews.Author: Maklouf1
Reviews.Content: The location between piazza del popolo and piazza de Spagna is perfect , to shop , to walk , to visit. The hotel and its garden are a gem . The rooms are beautifully decorated .The views over the city are charming. The only negative point is the pretentious restaurant : the Jardin de Russie.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, amazing courtyard with garden”
Reviews.Author: AlenaSimonova
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel de Russie and really enjoyed it a lot. The service is excellent, what I enjoyed the most is the restaurant. Not only the food is excellent, but the overall atmosphere of the restaurant is very lovely and cosy. Restaurant staff is just great, they make you feel like you have known them for ages. The view into the courtyard and garden is charming. I hope to come back in the summer and enjoy a wonderful breakfast in the garden. Thanks a lot!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: nicolas r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel De Russie for three nights. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and quickly shown to our room. This was a relatively large suite with a terrace overlooking St. Peter's Cathedral. It also had a sizeable walk-in closet and a beautiful bathroom. The linen and towels were always fresh, and the room itself was squeaky clean. Besides the excellent housekeeping, the reception staff was always very helpful with their suggestions. The hotel is in an excellent location right in the heart of the city within a short walk of the main attractions, shopping and really good restaurants but your advise on Porto di Ripetta Restaurant it was wonderful. As far as five star hotels go, the Hotel De Russie is certainly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel, set in a beautiful ancient garden.”
Reviews.Author: Mmedesevigne
Reviews.Content: A jewel of a hotel, set in a beautiful ancient garden -- an oasis of luxury and calm, in an ideal location near the Villa Borghese Gardens and easy walking distance to many of the fantastic museums and monuments of Rome. The rooms are filled with flowers and echoes of history, and the staff is wonderful -- special thanks to Concierge Alexandra, our "friend in Rome", for her creativity and charm.

Reviews.Title: “up to 5 stars standard”
Reviews.Author: jordan s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights when come back from Florence. Location: the best if you do shopping; prime area Room: stayed in superior room; spacious, clean, quiet Service: all I can say is GOOD; very attentive; polite Restaurant: I tried breakfast, lunch and dinner; authentic food and good service I will definitely come back when I come Rome again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: RobSq
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights during our trip and were very pleased with just about everything. Only two complaints, having to pay for WiFi and the lack of eggs included in the breakfast buffet. Otherwise excellent all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: dr_acdc
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended the hotel and they were right. My wife and my two teenagers just returned from three nights and wow, fantastic! First, the location is right at the Piazza Popolo and a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the Via Condotti. We walked to almost every tourist location you can imagine. All within 15-30 minute walks including the Vatican. We didn't have greats going in but we were quickly put at ease as the concierge desk helped us and made calls to reserve tickets. Got my confirmations by email, very cool. Next, the place is beautiful and the staff, especially Giuseppe, are total stars. We had breakfast every day in the restaurant which was amazing with very personal and attentive staff. What more can I say, this place is fantastic and will definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great location, and enchanting private garden are some of the highlights. The gym is small and serviceable, service AWESOME, particularly the good-natured concierge staff. Definitely a keeper/our future home in when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “we love the De Russie in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stijn v
Reviews.Content: After staying at the De Russie in Rome last September (2010) we decided to both begin and end this year's fall vacation at the same place. It is so easy to find--we I especially liked the people who worked the reception desk. They gave us excellent ideas for restaurants (Porto di Ripetta wonderful!), and they took time to run off directions to other places including the nearest Catholic church. We felt the hotel was extremely clean, the staff very friendly, and the breakfast was just delicious! Of course, I spent a lot of time in the spa and hot tub! Thanks again for the perfect beginning and ending to our trip to Maine!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: joanna T
Reviews.Content: What a pearl of a place. A gorgeous hotel, set right in the middle of the historical centre of rome. They deliver really high quality service very consistently, and obviously care about what they do. Yes, it is expensive, but wonderful and nice to stay in a place with luxury but warmth as well.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarenL
Reviews.Content: You step out of the hustle and bustle of Via del Baubino into the sanctuary of the Hotel de Russie. There are elegant and comfy sitting areas and then you walk through to the dining areas. The outdoor area has recently been updated. We try to come to the de Russie every year and were pleased to see that they were taking pride in the hotel. There is a lovely green decor and it just feels generally refreshed. My husband can't go past the buffet breakfast. The food is tasty, but it is the ambience and service that is really exceptional. The concierge service is amazing. They can answer every weird and wonderful request. I had promised my son a stuffed toy squirrel on our trip last year and had been looking for one all over Italy. I asked the concierge at the de Russie and without a blink of an eyelid, recommended a toy shop that she guaranteed would have every animal that we could think of - and it did! The spa and indoor pool areas are all well-mainted and relaxing. This hotel is a great base for exploring the delights of Rome and a great haven to return to after a hectic day. We look forward to coming back next year :)

Reviews.Title: “As good as hotels get at a price”
Reviews.Author: Bluehoops
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days and found it to be the perfect hotel for a city break. Everything was high quality and very tastefully done. Of course, it was expensive but you they do deliver an exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Goodtogotravel
Reviews.Content: This past summer, we had the pleasure of staying at the DeRussie in Rome. Its garden is lovely, a quiet oasis in a spectacular location in the center of the City. The food at its restaurant was actually the best we had in Rome, and the services of their Concierge staff were unparallelled. A true delight!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Russie - a place like home”
Reviews.Author: Andreja_L
Reviews.Content: An excellent location of this hotel captured between the Spanish stairs, villa Borghese and Piazza del Popolo is for sure a big bonus, but what makes it really special are its style (not over-designed as it sometimes happens, but with the right measure to keep it simple and yet cosy and comfortable) and its people. The hotel stuff will do everything to make your stay comfortable and happy. Energy that they transmit is relaxed and friendly, they are always ready to satisfy all your needs and desires. Big treasures of this hotel are also its excellent restaurant and one of the best SPA's in Rome and of course the secret garden where you can enjoy a nice meal or a good book and where in the evening you can enjoy a wonderful candlelight atmosphere in the heart of the wonderful Rome. A hotel which makes you fall in love with its atmosphere and which makes out of guests friends who will always be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite by a long shot”
Reviews.Author: nat f
Reviews.Content: We were here for four nights. The staff are very nice. The rooms (deluxe) are hit and miss. Certainly not special. The bad news? Crappy loud music in the court yard every night until 10-11pm that pounds your room. Sheets made out of cheese cloth - I am not kidding. If you want a very nice quiet special place in Rome, this is not for you. If you like listening tp an electronic guitar kitsh or disco pound and are okay with scratchy sheets, then go for it. Did I mention that the toilets are hard to flush? Again, the staff are great. For us, not a happy experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the Trip Advisor rating”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkarchitect
Reviews.Content: I know it's expensive,* but honestly, how can there be 180 hotels in Rome that are better. I have stayed at cheap hotels ($3 a night), as well as the Ritz in Paris, Claridge's in London and the Cipriiani in Venice, and this is one of the best hotels in the world. If money were no object, I would always stay here in Rome. I've stayed at hotels in Rome that get much higher ratings on TripAdvisor, like the Albergo del Senato, where I had a great room with a terrace overlooking the Pantheon. But the Russie is a better hotel. * When we stayed the Euro cost 82¢ and we had an offseason rate.

Reviews.Title: “Undoubtely the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TopVoyageur1965
Reviews.Content: Location, service, garden and courtyard are simply the best. The rooms are lovely and the quality of the food is excellent. Not to mention the type of the people attending here: wealthy guests, Roman, actors, singers, football players...where else would I stay?

Reviews.Title: “Next time its the Hassler again”
Reviews.Author: wilfried_graebert
Reviews.Content: As we didn't had a summer in Germany this year I wanted to end the season with a bang and booked 2 nights in Rome at the de Russie for a bit of City life and shopping and 3 nights at the Hotel Pelicano for a bit of seaside. I booked a romantic package ( 1 candle light dinner, 1 bottle of champagne and chocolate) for 800 Euro a night. I had been in the de Russie before for dinner and drinks. I liked it very much and thought it was a save bet. As others have said : The hotel location is perfect. The service is outstanding and personal. The restaurant is fantastic and the interior is very stylish. We enjoyed our first dinner and went straight to bed. The next morning I was a bit surprised by the room. It was small ( maybe 16m2) with a bed more queen than king size - the bathroom had only one washing basin and no seperate shower. It looked more like a single than a double room. The aircondition was a bit lound - not much but enough to make me try to shut it down and open the window. That was no good idea as it was very loud outside. Also I realized that oposite, less than 15 feet away, was an apartment with a window. These folks could see me and I could closely see what they where up to - Not really what you are looking for when you book a romantic package. The room was on the second floor - had no view and the toilet was giving strange loud noices when in use. Our second day in Rom was again fantastic - we wandered around , did some shopping and had a good lunch. After return my wife went to bed for a nap and I tried the sauna and wellness section of the hotel - absolutly outstanding. When I returned I told my wife lets get ready for another nice dinner and opened the free bottle of champagne - only to realize that is was Proseco ( according to the pricelist a 35 Euro value instead of 100+Euro for Champagne) We where so pissed off that we went to a restaurant outside the hotel. Sure, I booked a standard room - but when you pay 800 Euro a night you don't expect a very standard room ( with a max value of 250 Euro a night) Next morning when I was still struggeling with my mixed feelings for a verdict my beloved wife had a long look at me and simply said ' next time its the Hussler again'

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of tranquility in the heart of crowded Rome”
Reviews.Author: ed1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Russie has to rate as one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. From the moment I passed through the understated entrance into the cool lobby I felt relaxed and calm (not easy given the hordes of tourists in Rome). I had a quiet, deluxe room, which wasn't cheap, but was absolutely delightful. It had an elegant sitting room, bedroom and huge bathroom with separate walk in shower. There was a beautiful terrace overlooking the rooftops where I could enjoy the late afternoon sunshine and feel completely peaceful. The room had recently been refurbished and everything was first class quality, from bang and olufsen TV to linen sheets and decent toiletries. The hotel has a hydrotherapy pool, sauna and steam room, which were all very quiet. After a wonderful night's sleep, I had breakfast outside. The food was good quality but probably not the most plentiful I have seen, and it seems a bit cheeky to charge extra for eggs when you are paying so much for a room. I also had lunch at the bar which, although ok, I wouldnt rate as memorable (except for the price.) All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. Yes, it is expensive, but Rome is an expensive city. If you want a peaceful, calm luxurious hotel, right in the middle of all the action, then I think it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Markes29
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for walking around in the best shopping area of Rome. The hotel is like a Villa, with beatiful interior gardens to walk around. We stayed three nights in a standard room, well decorated, ample space, good bed, enough closet space, very good bathroom. We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel, and the food was excellent and the service better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel De Russie”
Reviews.Author: ASpencer-Churchill
Reviews.Content: It is the best hotel in Rome- wonderful staff and great rooms and the very best court yard.

Reviews.Title: “Only reviewing the Bar of Hotel de Russie”
Reviews.Author: charlotte_reviews
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to have a drink and enjoy views of the Borghese garden. Amazing setting, very attentive service, beautiful place to go while in Rome. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: pollyJapan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place to stay in Rome, close and handy to everything, the staff are all so friendly and helpful. The food is devine. This was our second time there and we wil be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: 4JC1
Reviews.Content: We were concerned by some of the negative reviews left but we should not have worried. This is a stylish hotel with a contemporary decor compared to some of the other 5 star hotels in Rome we considered. The garden is a real oasis in the centre of Rome and a very special place to dine in the evening. The concierge could not have been more helpful and all the staff had a smile. The champagne and birthday cake left in our room was a nice touch. I think glass shower screens would be more appropriate than shower curtains.Yes, maybe eggs should be included with breakfast and yes there are some missing mosaic tiles in the pool area but these are all minor points. We would definitely stay again and would highly recommend Hotel de Russie!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Garden. Best Location. Talented Concierge. Rooms could be modernized.”
Reviews.Author: MrGatsbys
Reviews.Content: Breakfast or drinks in the garden is a must. Staff is incredibly handsome, charming and slightly disorganized. Rooms could use modern amenities like a proper king bed instead of two twin beds pushed together. Shower curtains are not long enough or very useful. No cordless phone and art is a bit uninspired and hung inappropriately. Placement of furniture is also a bit off. Concierge directed us to best restaurants. Rooms were extremely expensive

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: CastleNY
Reviews.Content: I really expected this to be an exceptional hotel based on what I had heard and the expensive price tag. But truthfully, there was nothing remarkable about it other than the garden. The decor is sort of contemporary drab and the rooms were generic. And you have to pay for internet! The garden is worth visiting if you're prepared to pay 20Euro for a drink. But that's certainly a lot cheaper than a night at the hotel! Which is certainly not money well spent. I would recommend staying somewhere less expensive and with more character. Then just shell out some money for a leisurely drink... I regret staying here - just was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cindy f
Reviews.Content: is an enchanted place, seems to be in a film, all so beautiful, all kind, the first night we ate in the restaurant was excellent, all delicious, then we asked for advice to go out to eat, they suggested, but the Bolognese restaurant there I found a very bad ,bad food and all rude but this is not a problem of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and expensive mediocrity in a nice location/setting”
Reviews.Author: Areca_Catechu
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed by the Hotel de Russie in particular as I had heard positive things. Please keep in mind that this is a 5starL when you read the below. - Arrived at 15:00 and our room wasn't ready. Sebastiano, the front office assistant manager failed to apologise and almost tried to make it sound normal. Very unpleasant start especially when your room rate is around the EUR1k mark. As a way to make up for it and after 1hr of discussions, they offered to pay our lunch. However, the great thing there is that my wife had to wait 45' to receive her salad... - The FT newspaper never made it to my room for the first couple of days. The reception's excuse was that someone was playing with the newspapers - The concierge was rude and dry - The WiFi is something to pay and at a very expensive rate - The room service menu shows rates to which you need to add 15pc on top as it's room service menu. So if i receive it in the hall way do i not pay the 15pc? Why not just add the price and stop looking cheap? - One of the water bottles left by our bed side table had pidgeon excrement on it - The person in charge of the breakfast was intrucive and extremely loud. He kept on asking the same questions all 5 breakfasts we had there. On the breakfast: choice was limited and again for a 5starL it is surprising to see that the eggs were an additional charge. As you can see, what may look as a budget to start with at the Hotel de Russie needs to inflate as everything is on top of it. Nasty surprise was a hair on top of a muffin. Other nasty surprise was receiving dirty / stained napkins. - They say they have a pool but in reality kids below 12 cannot use it - The staff generally speak poor English. For example we would ask at breakfast not have them remove staff on our table and they would. Really unpleasant. - Most amazing of all is that they hosted a wedding in the main garden with music blasting up to almost midnight and waking us up. It seems all guests were up in arms calling reception and asking for them to stop this noise. We too called and had to request twice. Unbelievable for us and for the couple's wedding that had to be cut short; they should not offer this. - The room's furniture looked out of place and well organised. + Nice garden and setting in the centre of Rome + The bellboy, Christian (tall guy), was welcoming and a good guide + The location of the hotel is ideal to either side of the city + We had asked for quite some items for a baby boy which were all in the room

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel but Certainly not the Best”
Reviews.Author: BASLJM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Russie for 6 nights in June 2011. This was part of a nine-week European trip where we stayed in 12 hotels (primarily 5 stars). We almost always stay in Four Season Hotels when available and our review should be assessed on this standard. There is lots to like about the Hotel de Russie, and the hotel perhaps deserves its five star rating (though just!) but it is not even close to the standards of most Four Seasons Hotels, which became very obvious after staying for 5 days at the FSH in Florence (see our review) right after leaving the Hotel de Russie. The Hotel de Russie is a nice hotel, with decent size rooms and a beautiful courtyard (it's most attractive feature). The bathroom was a bit small (though not by European standards) and our room looked onto another building. It was disappointing not to have a courtyard room, though the one advantage of this is that we had no noise from the bar and the restaurant. We had the breakfast daily, which was excellent and, as others have commented on, the maitre'd and waitstaff are friendly and helpful. There is lots to choose from and my only disappointment is that you have to pay extra (lots!) to have eggs. The spa looks great (though we only used the pool) and the exercise room is excellent for a hotel of this size. Like others, we found the wifi charge to be an irritant, especially when paying 850 euros for the room. The hotel's location is excellent, about a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and 45 minutes to the Coliseum. The negatives: while our room was recently updated, and they did a very nice job of the bathroom, the furniture is quite cheap. The bathtub/shower is small and narrow. The bed sheets are horrible: they were so rough that my wife had burn marks on her elbows from rolling over during the night. The bellhops and concierge staff could certainly do with some service training and reflect poorly on the hotel. All-in-all we had a pleasant stay at the Hotel de Russie but until Rome gets a real first-class hotel, like the Four Seasons, the Hotel de Russie will be able to get away with charging five-star prices while only providing a four-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, great location, but the culture of concierge greed goes unabated.”
Reviews.Author: golflefty
Reviews.Content: Do I think this is the best hotel in Rome? It is if you simply avoid using the concierge staff. So, if you know Rome well and don't have special needs, you will have a great stay. Otherwise, bring your bank account to the concierge desk. Morning Restaurant staff, by the way, is brilliant - led by Mario.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: meldavall
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hotel De Russie. The location is perfect. You can walk to everything in the city! The service was excellent and the concierge was helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: kel7579
Reviews.Content: I had made dinner reservations at the restaurant, Jardin de Russie, for our "special" dinner. The night of our reservation, due to a late train, we ended up having to reschedule our reservation for the next night. The hotel was more than accommodating. We also spontaneously booked a room for that evening and checked out of our current hotel the next morning. Our room was fantastic. After three days of running around in the heat and the crowds of Rome, our room was a quiet and clean retreat. The bathroom was wonderful and clean. We napped wrapped in fluffy white towels and slippers. Our dinner was spectacular - since it was our honeymoon/my birthday, we received a bottle of wine AND a birthday cake. The restaurant was classy and romantic, yet our server still offered to take a photo of us when he saw my camera. When we returned to our room, we were greeted with a bottle of champagne on ice! There was a card with our names on it and a very nice note written inside. We ended the evening with champagne and another spin with those white robes and slippers! Though it was pricey, we absolutely enjoyed our stay here and would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: RCnewyork
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for touring. The staff was incredibly friendly and the rooms luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, wish I'd chosen another hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Hotel de Russie July 7 -11. It was the tail end of a 2 week tour of Italy, and I wanted to end the trip in a really nice hotel with a great location. One of the reasons I chose de Russie is that it was promoted as having children's programs and a pool. The pool was part of the wellness zone, and thus off-limits to children. Their children's program consisted of a list of activities suitable for children in the city of Rome (I had already purchased the book "Rome with kids", so didn't need another list!) The beds were hard as a rock, the restaurant was wonderful for the breakfast buffet included with our rooms, but terribly overpriced for dinner. The garden was lovely, but certainly not enough to warrant the excessive room charges. Staff is haughty, with the exception of waitstaff in the restaurant, who were exceptionally friendly and eager to please. All in all, of the four hotels we stayed in on our trip, this is the only one that felt like a real rip-off. Location was decent, but not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Unapologetically Bad”
Reviews.Author: tuttle999
Reviews.Content: We paid 800 Euros for a small deluxe suite with incredibly tacky furniture that was awkwardly placed in the room. There was, for example, an especially heinous circular fake wooden table with a fake gold zigzag base in front of our french doors leading to the garden--with no chairs (we stood at the window to drink our cappuccinos in the morning). It seemed like it was placed in the room haphazardly, and when I joked about having the hotel remove it, I lifted it up with one hand, it was so light. Then I noticed that most everything at this hotel looks like stone and marble and is actually made of plastic--seriously, even the marble relief carvings in the hallways are molded plastic. There was an orange ottomon in the room, a bright red plastic mini-bar/TV monstrosity, and a green chair. This random, cheap decor just did not compute at all for a hotel of this stature. The bathroom was acceptable, but the shower curtain was a stained, small liner that covered only 1/3 of the shower-tub combo--it was the likes of what you find in a Motel 6. My friend's main complaint was that the hotel lacks taste on just about every level, and was incredibly uncomfortable. The bed was rock-hard, the sheets were linen but improperly laundered and scratchy. There is an abhorrent lack of attention to detail everywhere you turn. Now for the lack of service: The room was moldy and smelled dank and damp and made both of us sneeze. They informed us that they did not have another room available other than the presidential suite, so we stayed (it was only the last night). They wanted to charge us 20 Euros for 24 hours of internet access although we checked in at 7:00pm and had to leave at 5:30am without breakfast the next day and needed just several hours' worth of internet service after dinner to get organized before our departure back to NYC. When I explained that we were unhappy with the room and that we would like them simply to comp us for the internet, Reception explained to us that they were "unauthorized" to do anything for us and that we would have to go through a formal complaint process and talk to various supervisors to complain. After having stayed at the most luxurious, beautiful hotels all through Italy with exceptional service, this reply was just unacceptable! No one wants to waste even 10 minutes of their time complaining to "supervisors" at a hotel. Hotels are in the hospitality business and their staff is hired to make people feel comfortable and taken care of. The last thing we wanted was to deal with some bureaucratic overstructure--more typical of a Holiday Inn-level property--in order to get our internet access comped. We were not asking for anything complicated, and the person at Reception could easily have made a better effort to convince us that he would even try to accommodate our request (we didn't ask for a discount on the room or demand to be moved, for example--just free internet for the several hours we would need it in the room to get organized for our departure). Unfortunately, every other interaction with Reception was similarly bizarre and revealed their utter lack of training and thoughtfulness. Nothing we asked about was answered immediately; everything was a "call back." Many answers were "no." The only thing Reception is capable of doing efficiently, evidently, is taking your credit card and charging you for your joke of a five-star room.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: jimmysi
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Russie came highly recommended by some friends who stayed there recently so we actually changed our plans and cancelled reservations at The Eden in favor of the Russie. What a mistake. When we arrived we had engaged the hotel's car service to pick us up at the Rome airport...we looked around for a bit and didn't see him holding the sign but eventually spotted the driver not at all looking for us or interested in eyeing the arrivals exit. We had a perfectly pleasant ride into town and were greeted at the door by a reservationist who said he was going to take us directly to our room and check us in there. How nice! But wait, it was a mistake! That was for someone else...oops, "please go wait at the front desk for a moment". Our room wasn't ready. Well that was OK as it was only 1p so we went and had lunch at the lovely outdoor restaurant. In fact, the beautiful courtyard bar and restaurant are the best thing about this hotel. The maitre'd is very friendly as are the rest of the staff. We had a lovely lunch and were informed that our room was ready. We were taken up to the third floor to room 320, a "deluxe double"...what a disappointment. The room was tiny and faced a back alley (not the courtyard as we requested) and a neighbor's back terrace that was so close you could reach out and touch it. I asked if anyone lived there and the man who took us to our room said he'd never seen anyone there (a little old lady came out almost as if on cue a few minutes later so we had to keep our curtains closed the whole time). This beautiful old building has been ruined by Rocco Forte with uninspiring furniture and a very mediocre renovation. Reminds me a lot of Brown's in London (another Rocco Forte property) as I think it has the exact same furniture! In any event for 700 Euros a night this was ridiculous so the next morning we asked to change rooms. We were upgraded to a "studio room", room 214, which was quite lovely...20-foot ceilings, gigantic bathroom, much more in keeping with the lofty price we were paying compared to the "Ramada" level room from the prior night. There's a beautiful spa which has jacuzzi's, steam, sauna, etc...I had a massage only to find that the rooms face out onto that courtyard...children were playing (and screaming) just outside my treatment room so to the spa's credit they moved the massage to my room at no extra charge which was fine. There are a lot of hotels near the Spanish Steps that are much less per night...I just don't think that these prices are warranted here...for $1,000 per night for a basic room category there should be more wow factors (though linen sheets on the bed were admittedly a nice touch)...everything from cheap toilet paper, bare minimum bathroom amenities and cookie cutter Ikea-like furniture is out of place. We won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: hllavat
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good service and high quality details

Reviews.Title: “Please read if you are considering staying here”
Reviews.Author: Thirsty_goat
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel De Russie somewhat at the last minute and without a lot of research on the different hotels in Rome cause we ran out of time. I did read some of the reviews here and was a little concerned but went with it cause of time constrictions. Here is my review. I have to be honest, I am fairly picky and notice the small things. I have stayed in Four Seasons hotels all over the world and they set the standard for me. The room rate average was $1,600.00 dollars per night. Upon pulling up to the hotel, the curb appeal was pretty unimpressive. The building was dirty and chunks of the building was missing right in front of the entrance. The front desk staff was dressed well and took our bags right away which was good but the greeting was not that great-just seemed like a fomality to him. Entering the building is also not that impressive. No sense of entry. The staff that we had to check in was pretty cold and barked at us for our passports. The room was not ready (we arrived around 1PM I believe) so they told us to have lunch outside in the restaurant outside. The courtyard is really pretty and nicely landscaped. The waiters were not very pleasant and seemed annoyed with us for some reason. The room was ready by 3PM. The room was larger then I expected which was a nice surprise. Like other reviews here, the room did smell like mold. The room is appointed ok but certainly nothing special at all. The TV was tiny. The bathroom was a fair size and again ok but nothing special. My first experience with concierge was I would say very poor. I asked for a couple of different recommendations based upon my DK travel book and he basically picked a random restaurant that wasn't on my list and said go here. He called to make the reservation after I said ok and made it for two people. I told him as fast as I could that it needed to be for three and he scoffed and looked angry he had to call them back. We did experience a younger gentleman in concierge that was very very pleasant. bottom line spotty service. The elevators were tiny and scuffed up along with scratched tile. And as other reviews have said, one of the elevators was broken. Broken for 2 days. To be honest, I really don't see how people could give this hotel a glowing review. It really makes me think the management is writing the reviews because this is a terrible value and not even close to a 5 star hotel. And I don't need a message from management because it means nothing to me and you have responded to other guests in the past saying blah blah blah but you haven't fixed anything. The same problems over and over again. Rome is tough if you really want a great hotel it seems like. There is no Ritz or Four Seasons, Mandarin or even a true St. Regis? I heard it is a partner hotel. Anyway, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Craze_11
Reviews.Content: I spend 5 heavenly days with my husband at the Hotel de Russie in April - and would rate it as one of the best city hotels that I have stayed in, very elegant in a contempory way, our room was spacious and comfortable, the gardens heavenly - a perfectly located haven in a tourist filled Rome. Of particular note was the excellent service across the board - the hotel is very efficiently run and the staff warm and charming - we had a particularly positive experience with the deputy general manager - Francesco Ascani who bent over backwards to assist us when temporarily misplaced a lap top. I would highly recommend the Hotel de Russie for both business and pleasure in Rome and look forward to visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “excellence you pay for”
Reviews.Author: watchdogBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding and the quality of the rooms and public areas second to none. Everything worked and well. The spa was one of the best for products and service ( not a swimming pool though) but then not busy (cost) and the same with the restaurants and bars. A special mention for Mirko at reception. The piano player was a hidden pleasure. Very good for children with special food, robes, gifts and treatment. The Easter egg was a very nice present with the llittle note, that was very kind. Tips to get the best from your stay are: Make full use of the concierge to organise everything and then relax after a long day in the pool. Start with a time defined (stick to it with the guide) tour and organised events but once you have become familiar you can do it cheaper yourself...but may heave to queue more.... For example I believe all the facilities have an uplift for the hotel clients but then we walked into events and taxis in front of every-one-else who had queued. A perfect hotel for those who are cash rich and time poor.

Reviews.Title: “'The Place' to be seen in the Heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Tellippiatt
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed Hotel with a spacious bar and restaurant terrace with the backdrop af the Bhorgese gardens. Friendly but efficient staff. Restaurant good but only just 2 Michelin Star. Probably will improve when new waiters are fully trained. Stones throw from the Spanish Steps near all the chic shops. Our suite overlooking the garden was very quiet for the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travellingKoalas
Reviews.Content: The thing is, in Rome, there are many five star hotels to choose from, more so than in other big cities I have been to. Well, in my view, many such hotels do not deserve their 5 'stelle'. That was the case of the Splendid-Royal where we also stayed, which was mediocre in every way, given its price tag. And again, my wife and I walked by quite a few other so called five stars establishements, which looked tired and unwelcoming. Not the case of The Hotel de Russie. As soon as you step out of the cahotic street, you walk into an oasis of calm and serenity, with smiling staff, willing to please. The inner courtyard and garden shelters you from the outdoor world, and, weather permitting, it is a wonderful place to sit in, at all time of the day, or evening. If it gets chilly, someone will promptly wheel an outdoor heater to your table. The suite we had was fairly compact, and very contempoary in style. It had a large terrace with a wonderful view of the roofs of Rome from its fith floor. The modern style might not be to everyone's taste, but for me it worked fine, as the furnishing was of good taste, and high in quality. Well equiped with two telivisions, and a dvd player was brought to us on our request. The bed was hard, too much so, but that may be a charateristic in Italy. Service level never disappointed. This is a very well managed hotel, and I was aware of many managers walking around, inspecting the work of the staff. It does make a big difference. Just a tip for those who fly there. The hotel car which we took on the way back to the airport was about 30 euros more than a regular taxi, and you will be driven in superb comfort in an S class Mercedes, well worh the extra.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing after Florence & Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: detailsbybp
Reviews.Content: Overall, our experience at Hotel de Russie was fair. The location was great, if you want to be in the heart of the historical area. Our biggest complaint is that their own website was misleading. I booked the room on the Hotel de Russie website and our confirmed reservation said that we would have a city view. Even though our room was on the 3rd floor of the hotel, our view was of a narrow walkway between two buildings, necessitating bars on the windows and offering no privacy from the building next door. Second, the bed was absolutely the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept on. Third, this was the only place we stayed in Italy where we were treated rudely. The doormen did not greet us, the concierge was usually distracted. On the other had, the restaurant staff (breakfast) went out of their way to make guests feel welcome. In addition at the rate you pay at Hotel De Russie, you would think that such things as internet would be included, but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Russie exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: margarethouck
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in, the fine staff at Hotel De Russie made us feel so welcomed! After an all-night flight, we arrived at 9am and expected to not be able to check in until much later. However, the friendly reception staff not only helped us check in early, but they upgraded us to a beautiful Jr. Suite! We were delighted with our spacious and comfortable room - the beds were incredibly soft, and the linens luxurious. The following morning we mistakenly showed up for the breakfast buffet 1/2 hour early. Instead of asking us to return at 7am, the maitre de Mario invited us to sit down and served us coffee and croissants. His kindness and generosity set the tone for the rest of our stay at HdR. We couldn't think of a nicer way to be introduced to Rome, than by this wonderful staff. I have stayed at 5-star hotels where many of the staff have an "attitude" of snobbishness and elitism. It is very important to me to feel welcomed, and the Hotel de Russie staff did this in spades! I can recommend this fine hotel without reservation, and I look forward to the time when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and noisy but great location”
Reviews.Author: paulatricky
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently spend 4 nights at the Russie. We booked as i have stayed before in Rocco Forte properties and enjoyed them. Here though we were sadly disappointed. Our room was a good size, but the view was not over the lovely garden but of a building opposite where we looked right into an office (and so the occupants looked right into us). Worse though was their plumbing problems. Whenever our neighbours (above or to the side) visited the bathroom, little was left to the imagination and the noise of the toilet flush lasted 48 seconds and sounded like concorde taking off. Happening 3 times one night (12, 3 and 5 o'clock) this resulted in a distubed night. With no carpets wardrobe doors, room doors, voices all echoed loudly. Outside was a cobbled path where trollies were noisily wheeled early in the mornings. I remember cheap Med hotels in the 80's when i was a student being like this but not EXPENSIVE 5-star properties. I complained to the front-desk, but was only given a "very sorry, we note your comments" response. On check-out mangement were very apologetic but did not offer us any recompense and the earlier complaint has clearly not been noted. This is clearly a systemic problems as you could hear the pumbing all around our wing I do not know if it occurs elsewhere in the hotel). If you do book here, DO NOT accept rooms without a garden view (rooms with numbers around 110-130 and i presume others) and make sure you ask about the plumbing problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: Travelgeek207
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing and it was sososososososososososososo clean our room got upgraded and there was no noise at all

Reviews.Title: “Heaven is Hotel De Russie”
Reviews.Author: McRoberts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly situated. Beautifully renovated with exsquisite taste. Staff who go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. Fabulous food and glorious gardens. Whats not to like.

Reviews.Title: “You can't help loving it”
Reviews.Author: alfa2727
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel de Russie didn't get off to the best of starts, despite booking a room with a king bed we were given one with two singles, also the room was very tired and had a weird odour, on complaining about the beds we were repeatedly told that someone would call us back. It was already late in the evening and our dinner reservation was close and we didn't know whether to unpack or not, or start getting ready etc After waiting for about half an hour eventually a member of house keeping arrived at the room with sheets to turn the two singles into a double. Still preferring a real king rather than this improvisation i went down to reception and a helpful lady there showed me to another room that had a king bed and felt slightly newer, although still tired which was surprising for such an expensive hotel. If it had been a bit cheaper i wouldn't have been bothered by these things but when you're paying over $600 a night you expect to have a top quality room with the bed of your choice. But over the course of the weekend we realised what the real value of this hotel was. It is very well located and has the most beautiful garden. You could sit there for hours under the heaters having cocktails or eating. After a few hours we had completely forgotten about our room and couldn't have cared less about its shortfalls. There is something so charming about the hotel that I couldn't imagine every staying elsewhere, it completely seduced us. Just writing this review makes me want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Overcharges on Everything”
Reviews.Author: balticdude4
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Hotel de Russie and booked a few nights in January. When I arrived at the hotel, I was a bit shocked and disappointed. The reception area could have been any budget hotel in the area. I was cold and lacked the elegance you would expect for the price. I just wondered why they didn't have a more elegant interior...it was just plain and cold. When I went to the room, it was adequate but not what you would expect for the price. To make matters worse, you have to pay for the internet, which is irritating since you are already paying a premium price! I ordered room service and the dinner was okay, but the restaurant forgot one of the orders. When I called, they apologized and brought it right up but forgot to bring the utensils so I had to call them back again. Not a great result from a 5 star hotel! Breakfast downstairs was a nice atmosphere, but the buffet had very little food on it. It was a lot of cheese, cold cuts, and bread but not much else to choose from (and all at a whoping price of 35 euros each)! The concierge was okay, but I found that he would only recommend the obvious places. I found that I knew more interesting places that were not touristy. The best tip I got was from the manager of the spa who recommended a delightful restaurant near the hotel which was the best place we went to in Rome (and the best value for the money). Everyone else was friendly, but I'm not sure if I would go back. I've stayed at fine hotels all over the world and this one just lacked something. Like the other reviewers, if they had just provided a little something extra, it would have taken away some of the feeling of being constantly ripped off at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “My top choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alexandradf
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Rome and know it quite well. The de Russie is my favorite hotel in the city. For my full review of this hotel with pictures, please visit my blog post on the Hotel de Russie at: http://www.destinationsperfected.com/search/label/Hotel%20de%20Russie

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we picked wrong time of year........”
Reviews.Author: hhreese
Reviews.Content: Usually we go to a warm climate for the holidays, and I think we will return to that policy next year. Yes it was winter and Europe was cold. It was very cold in Rome and in our room! Staff worked on our heat, but it never seemed to get comfortable. In hindsight we should have changed our room. We faced the street also, it was noisy. We did find all the staff to be helpful and friendly. The manager at breakfast was VERY friendly and efficient. The concierge helped with questions and special arrangements. We have stayed at Four Seasons and Leading Hotels of World. Not sure I can fully recommend de Russie.

Reviews.Title: “Our Small Piece of Heaven in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: marwanf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! From the warm welcome, the excellent service, beautiful rooms, great food and perfect advice for dinning and activities (thanks to Alexandra the concierge) this hotel is really a no brainer when you’re in Rome and ready to indulge! As other reviews might tell you, the hotel is actually an old noble estate giving the hotel so much charm with details such as a quaint courtyard with a spectacular garden that makes for a sanctuary within bustling Rome. We appreciated it the most during our typical Italian breakfast with the best cappuccino’s ever! The rooms were very comfortable and stylish. Most importantly they were quiet and a great way to start our honeymoon off. I strongly recommend staying here if you love pampering yourself. Can’t wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: john189400
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The location is perfect. The room was unacceptable, we payed 650 euro/night and the heating of the room was not working. Moreover, there was water dropping from the cealing. Nobody came to fix the problems notwithstanding the continuous calls at the reception. As a result we did not sleep for these two nights. Terrible (executive !) room.

Reviews.Title: “cool and chic at once”
Reviews.Author: easy_vienna
Reviews.Content: very designed and cool place in the center of Rome, the hotel is located close to the shopping area and the gzuys working there try are super friendly. The rooms are extremely tastefull and the ambience is outstanding. In the center of the hotel, there is a small garden, which is excellent for drinks and/ or coffee. The hotel is recommended to everybody with taste and some extra money.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but costly with lots of attitude”
Reviews.Author: charwood525
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the De Russie from Florence, we were tired and ready to hit our room, but the room wasn't ready. It was after two, but we were shown to the bar and offered a drink. 15 minutes later we were given the bill. So much for the free drink. We were escorted to our room, lovely, but small and very pricey. When asked about wireless internet service, I was told there was a 20 euro charge. I couldn't believe it. I was shocked. Now, i felt ripped off. After complaining to my travel agent, i got the free drink plus a bottle of wine and a cake, but who wants the free wine and cake. I wanted free internet service. Why do hotels always comp things you don't want. Such as a 35 euro discount at the hotel's restaurant. Unfortunately, the cheapest thing on the menu is plain pasta for 20 euros. it's a rip off. But i have to say, the hotel is beautiful. The garden stunning. the service excellent even though the concierge was cold and critical. I wouldn't go back, but it's worth a visit with the wonderful maitre de at breakfast. He's the real thing. A lovely friendly man who was on top of his game. Perhaps the hotel should make him the general manger. Then I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly poor on modernity and low value for money”
Reviews.Author: LucaNavigator
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located and here are pros and cons: PRO - bed sheets of high quality - smiling personnel - well decorated rooms CONS - no Internet in the room unless you want to pay 20€ PER DAY and connect via CABLE. This is absurd it is as if they say: "you pay 500€ per night but TV is extra, or hot water is extra". Internet is more important than TV why is TV included and 20€ for the web?? - rooms are small and air is not changed frequently (they smell a little bit) - bathrooms are old - if you want eggs and bacon you have to pay EXTRA. Again no reason to charge me 16€ for 2 eggs My colleague who was travelling with me shares the same opinion. It does speak volumes if a hotel which gets so much money for a room than tries to squeeze few bucks out of you. You need 36€ more? Please charge me 536€ for the room and give me Internet and 2 eggs in the morning !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful my favorite place in Europe”
Reviews.Author: JoPeBr
Reviews.Content: Just beautiful, excellent service and wonderful restaurant. We loved it. The area is extremely busy and noisy but the rooms were quiet and just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: blondeylocks
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night in this hotel but I won't forget it. As a business traveller I have become a little bored with "5*" chain hotels, same decor different city. The Hotel de Russie had definitely broken away from that. Beautifully appointed spacious rooms. Magnificent courtyard away from the hussle and bussle of Rome. It is expensive but its worth it and I can't wait to go back, hopefully on a pleasure trip the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful long romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sandra-john1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the De Russie and were delighted to have been upgraded to a Junior Suite overlooking the Street. which we were pleased about as the scenery is always changing. We know that there are many rooms overlooking the beautiful gardens, but that view always stays the same that is of the garden. Our room was extremely spacious with two balconies, a sofa and two arm chairs, a desk and chair and a centre table and a very nice television, very clean and in excellent and tasteful decorative condition. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. The buffet breakfast was absolutely perfect, in fact what made it very special were the staff who realising that my husband and I liked a certain table and they kept that table for us for breakfast for the duration of our stay - we did not ask them to nor did they do that for financial reward - but just because they saw that we were happy there. The food at the buffet breakfast was superb - I had prosecco to start with some smoked salmon followed by various cheeses and cold meats. My husband enjoyed the cereal and yogurt selection and nothing was too much trouble. On the first night we did have dinner in their garden restaurant which was beautifully lit by so very many candles - very romantic dining under the stars by candlelight - but the food although my meal was tasty my husband felt that his meal could have been better but the surroundings and the service were just simply lovely. After a long day of sightseeing it was a pleasure to go into the Spa and use their jacuzzi and my husband enjoyed the Sauna as well as the jacuzzi - you can really unwind and all the aches disappear. The location could not be better - not far from anything. The staff were very helpful, we had a very late flight back so they helped us with our baggage storing it for us, and put our valuables into their safe deposit box. On the whole a very efficiently run hotel with excellent staff and a truly memorable holiday was enjoyed by us.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - poor service; huge suite, no style”
Reviews.Author: allesandra
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the Hassler but it was entirely booked.I never liked the idea of the :De Russie"...it has received such mixed reviews on this site; and, as a member of Andrew Harper, I have heard mixed reviews through their client blog (although it is recommended by AH). The location is tops...equally close to the lovely Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps (and the fan of streets leading from the Spanish Steps. It is a straight line from the hotel to the Piazza della Venezia. The hotel is dreary and a bit run-down. It really does not have a modern decor, but it isn't old-school luxurious either. We had an extremely large Junior Suite with a separate office-type room near the entrance to the suite. Off this "office" we had a lovely patio. The three huge windows overlooked the 'secret garden".....the view and quiet were lovely. I cannot understand why anyone would choose this hotel. The rooms at the Hassler are smaller, but the Panorama of the city from the top of the Steps is unforgettable. The back-facing rooms are pretty enough so the view is largely not missed (especially if you haven't seen it). But what sets the Hassler apart from the de Russie is the cleanliness and the seriously professional service at the Hassler. The rooms are gleamingly spotless. The concierge is dignified and all the staff is quiet and elegant and formal and knowledgeable. To be fair to the de Russie, I arrived from Florence by train; during the journey my wallet was stolen: I arrived at the hotel with no cash or credit cards and the de Russie Front Office Manager greeted me at the entrance and directed the staff to charge the taxi to my room. He was quite sympathetic and he offered assistance. although there was none which could be provided. But if my room had not been so large and so expensive, I would have thought I was in a tour-bus quality hotel: as I said, run-down furniture, the tiniest television I had ever seen and an unimpressive bathroom with a very stingy supply of unremarkable bath products. At all the other five star hotels I have visited in Italy have always outfitted the bathrooms with excellent products. There was a huge amount of closets and lots of comfortable room to sit: a huge sofa, enormous coffee table, club chairs, desk, etc. But drab and dreary with no thought to style whatsoever. The bed was creepy: the mattress pad did not fit the mattress and the sheets were constantly unravelling from underneath the mattress. My son was covered with at least thirty welts when he woke up on the morning: I canfnot claim bed bugs...perhaps they were mosquito bites, but I truly don't know. I also saw a mouse run across the room during the morning, in full daylight.. The housekeepers were loud and rolled their service carts down the halls outside the rooms while gabbing away....I don't generally see this type of housekeeping service at this calibre of hotel. Usually, especially in Europe, the housekeeping is very discreet....not a rolling cart in sight. What I experienced at the de Russie is what I expect from a chain motel. The Stravinsky Bar looked nice, but the staff was unreceptive and as chilly as the night air. We ate in their highly touted restaurant. The food was so dreadful for dinner that I literally could not eat one bite of my main dish. Again, the service was indifferent. They did remove the charge for our main dish. But I noticed that the tables where there were "romantic couples" seated enjoyed more appropriate service, befitting a "fine dining" restaurant.. I guess they anticipated more course would be ordered and more bottles of wine were to be sold to couples. I was dining with my young son. We were both properly dressed and ordered full meals; our bill was certainly worthy of decent service. Not a smile in sight. Also, this was the first hotel that did not send up a treat for my son, or even a scaled down bathrobe. Every hotel in every country on every trip gave my son a gift ranging from t-shirts to stuffed animals to delicious chocolate treats...the whole gamut. The Ritz in London took my son for a ride in its magnificent Rolls Royce (and there our room rate was one-third the cost of the room at this dump in Rome). Now the concierge! The first morning we approached the concierge. The woman who bowled us down was aggressive, dismissive, and totally unhelpful. Inasmuch as we had been to Rome several times, we were definitely not interested in the bus tours, chauffered cars and extremely expensive rip-off activities with highly padded fees that would have benefitted the concierge at our expense. During our last visit to Rome, we hired an extremely knowledgeable private guide to take us through a four-hour visit to the Vatican. It was a true highlight of a month-long trip to Europe: our guide was interesting and navigated us through the throngs of people. My son was only nine and he enjoyed every last second of this private tour. When I told the concierge about my son's interest in these types of activities, she looked at me like I was crazy and told me that it was inappropriate for me to hire an art historian, for example, or history expert, to guide us through the other interesting parts of Rome because it would be wasted on a kid. She discouraged us from taking a day trip to Hadrian's Villa or Naples unless we hired a car and driver for the day. She also offered to get us a 1/2 hr. horse and buggy ride for the bargain price of 200 Euro (these rides were available literally right outside the hotel door for 150 Euro - still a rip off in my opinion). She only wanted to send us to ridiculous, unimaginative venues. She sent us to an attractiion called "Rewind" near the Colesium: she claimed it was exciting and would be perfect for my son. It was a joke! a five minute 3D movie that was completely uninformative and was basically a prelude to a huge gift shop the size of the Colesium itself. We were literally the only two people at this so-called attraction. We have done some corny attractions in some other cities: the London Dungeon comes to mind; also Ripley Believe it or Not....this was a pathetic five minute nothing and provided not even fun in that type of cheesy fun that can be a great way to fill up a day with a child. Beyond boring and a disappointment is the way to describe this activity. Also, it robbed us of the time we could have spent seeing something interesting. The concierge also told us that if we didn't hire a private car it would be "impossible" to find a cab to take us back to the hotel. Ridiculous! There were dozens of cabs. The hotel also clipped us for a ridiculous enterprise: it recommended a "school" where my son would have a blast learning how to be a gladiator at a price of 100 Euro. This god-foresaken place was a run-down, ramshackle bunch of shacks on a side road of the Appian Way. When we arrived, it was creepy: a mean man started barking orders at my son. The activity was by appointment; the concierge told us that way we were sure to have other boys and girls particpating. Once again, my son and I were the only people there, except for this vicious man. He made homophobic comments to my slightly built son (age 10). He told him he wasn't a real man because, being left-handed, he naturally picked up his replica sword with his left hand. There were ramshackle picnic tables, a dirty yard with no equipment save a bunch of ropes with sand bags hanging from the ends. He insisted my son run through these moving targets over and over again and was as mean as could be when my son "messed up." Before this misanthrope allowed my son to actually participate in the activity we had come for, we were taken into a makeshift dank and mouldy"museum where this man proceeded to tell us every trivial detail about every helmet, sword, shield and weapon in the collection. There was no place to sit; no refreshment center, no water....nothing. It was boiling hot and I couldn't believe that for 100 Euro we were not even provided with the opportunity to purchase a water or sit on a bench. All we had was this mean man, a dank, dark "museum"(really a garage with discarded junk)....and a ten minute lesson on how to block moves this man made in his simulated attempt to vanquish my 65 pound son. He barked and yelled and growled at us both. When the 2 hour torture was over, he kindly called a cab for us, but not before asking a host of prying questions including my age and our religion. I always hate when people go on in TripAdvisor reviews about things that have nothing to do with the hotel...e.g. stupid attractions or bad weather or construction down the road. But HERE the CONCIERGE at this FIVE STAR HOTEL scammed us into these activities!!! I really felt hood-winked, we were robbed by this band of misfits, just as I was robbed by a thief of my wallet on the train! The bill, at checkout, was full of errors.
