For example, the suite came with a "package" that entitled us to watch unlimited pay-per-view movies. We watched three in three days and they tried to charge us for two of them. They also tried to charge us for water at our buffet breakfast: the breakfast was included in the 1700 Euro a night rate. The buffet had water, all types of juices, Prosecco, etc. We had no tea, no coffee, no juice no prosecco. All we had was water and one criossant each. And they had the nerve to try to charge us 15 Euro for water at each breakfast (for which they had no bill or signature, etc.) They never provided me with the Nokia cell-phone during my stay for complimentary local calls. And, as a parting salvo, we used their car and driver service (at four times the price of a cab). The driver, summarily dumped our bags on the curb, no where near the entrance to the terminal nor near the ranks of luggage carts: a middle aged woman and her son....what courtesy! Again, this would not appear in a review of the hotel if the hotel had not provided the service. The concierge was a scourge on the pride this profession generally takes in its important job at luxury hotels (especially in Europe where they truly "run the show") to ensure guests' needs and desires are met at every turn.I'd never go back to Rome...but I cannot tell if it isn't because of the truly vexing experience I had at the hotel which overshadowed the days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hb7176
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is very expensive and the basic rooms can be quite small, but this hotel in a true gem. I love the chic, contemporary furnishings and the exceptional service. The courtyard garden is unique and stunning! The restaurant is superb. I have stayed at this hotel eight times and I have never been disappointed! My only complaint is that they do not have wireless internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend in eternal city”
Reviews.Author: CzechTourist
Reviews.Content: we arrived at night and were impressed by the view to the garden (the place we admired the most in the hotel) and foayer. The welcome by the receptionist was not very warm but we were looking forward to have a drink in the garden bar so we did not pay much attention to it. Even though we were upgraded to higher category of room we were not very satisfied as the room had just windows facing dark space between the houses. The service in the bar and at the breakfast was attentative and together with the garden atmosphere really relaxing and we felt very italian. the wellness / SPA was fine . The hotel was newly decorated in modern way and keeping in mind italian style. The location of hotel is superb. It is in short walking distance to piazza di spagna and main shopping area via dei condotti. Also the limousine service to the airport was OK, as well as concierge services. We really enjoyed the atmospere and charm of the hotel and had great time. We are looking to come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical, Restful & Special Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DeeCeeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about our stay at the de Russie. There were a few hiccups but about 99% of our stay was great. Firstly, I emailed extensively with the concierge prior to our trip and they were very helpful. Even when there was confusion with our reservation upon check-in, they sorted it our pretty quickly. The tour guide the concierge hooked us up with (her name is Michaela and you should ask for her by name if you want a totally amazing tour of any part or place in Rome. Worth twice the price!). The first day we went to the Vatican Museum (Sistine, etc.) and the tour was outstanding! The next day we did a "Rome Highlights" tour. Another impressive day. Breezed by any line and learned SO much. Awesome. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The hotel has the perfect location. They made our trip with our 2 1/2 year old daughter feel like a breeze! The room was large beautiful and quiet even though it was on the street side and not a garden view. The garden is totally magical, by the way! Our daughter could explore and run around at breakfast without a problem. We wanted to take my mother someplace special (but still kid friendly) for her 65th birthday and the concierge sourced out the perfect place where the manager treated by toddler like she was the most special guest at the place! A great hotel for families (we saw lots of families from all over the world at breakfast with kiddos ranging in age from toddler to teen and they staff was all very pleasant, etc. with the kids). Had an awesome massage at the hotel spa, too! Not to be missed. Lovely people running the spa. Loved the Russie! Hope to return someday - recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “Hardly Anything to Complain About”
Reviews.Author: fratspin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights this past summer. The location is excellent, and located within walking distance of much of the shopping that is near the Spanish Steps. The restaurant inside this hotel has an excellent breakfast and lunch, but dinner was nothing special. However, the setting of the restaurant, which is located within a garden in the courtyard is very nice and quiet. The rooms are what you would expect from any high end hotel, so they did not in anyway disappoint. This is only 1 of 2 places that I have stayed in Rome, so I cannot compare it to a lot of other places, but I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location and Great service”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: De Russi has a nice location very near the Spanish steps and the Piazza Del Poppolo. The hotel has nice feel with wonderful service and a nice resturant. The rooms , plse do expect the European "size". Suprisingly the lifts and hallways are wider that your average european hotel. Great service. One of the best hotels in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location - Best in Rome but Pricy”
Reviews.Author: oslonorwayoslo
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of place where they greet you by name and delivers service with a smile. The Location is unbeatable, just a short walk from the Spanish steps, all the sights of Central Rome and the best shopping. They also have a very nice inner courtyard with a good restaurant and a tiny garden). It is very of the place! The rooms are ok, but nothing spectacular - our Junior Suite did not have a separate shower in the bathroom just the bathtub. It also faced the street - be sure to ask for a room facing the courtyard as these are probably much nicer. But all this come at a price - we payed 1400 Euro for just one night and then breakfast was not included. After dinner and breakfast we ended up with a bill around 2000 Euro. If you book ahead you will certainly score a better deal - and if you do, this is probably the best place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends at this wonderfully located hotel. It was a 3 minute walk from the Spanish steps and 30 seconds away from all the shops and boutiques. The staff was very accomodating although one or 2 of them could barely speak any english they were still pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a good selection and the main outdoor restaurant was lovely for lunch or a late afternoon drink. The only thing that bothered me was that the tv was way too small for such a "modern" hotel. We were 3 in a room so we had a "suite" although to be honest it wasnt really considered a suite and was pretty pricey. I saw the single rooms and they were a bit small but had a nice cosy feel to it. Except for the price and the tv (which you wont be watching much anyway) i would definitly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too expensive for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: FrankfurtGypsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights on the way to southern Italy to get a taste of Rome. The hotel is conveniently located to visit a lot of the main attractions like the Spanish steps. They offer to organize free entry to Villa Borghese, which is supposed to be one of the most impressive museums but they didn't tell us at check-in that we have to book far in advance as slots are taken up quickly so in the end we did not get a slot. The hotel building itself doesn't look too impressive, but almost a bit run down already. The rooms are very nicely decorated and in good condition however.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: LuxurynCulture
Reviews.Content: Decided to splurge, after having heard so much about this hotel. Stayed just two nights and wished it could have been longer. The whole package is perfection. From the location, the restful interiors, the beautiful gardens and the breakfast buffet, it really is hard to beat. Check-in was smooth, professional and friendly. The room (and bathroom) was one of the most thoughtfully laid out and beautifully decorated in its 6! -star class - a pleasure to spend time in it. Have never stayed at its sister hotel Brown's in London but I don't recall from photos that it has the same style. de Russie was amazingly quiet even though the Spanish Steps were just at the end of the street 200m away. Every of the staff I encountered were warm and friendly, the concierge was a wealth of information who recommended a great restaurant Due Ladrons at Piazza Nicosia (do not miss!), the rooms impeccable . I had a very early fight to catch and consequently a very early check out at 4.30am but the reception desk did not miss a beat, and even offered me a take-away croissant from the trays that had just arrived for breakfast. They are not only a fine example for other hotels to emulate, they are also a great example for Italian hospitality in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, if a touch rough around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: BochanTraveller
Reviews.Content: The De Russie really does so much right. From its exceptional location abutting Piazza del Popolo to the gorgeous terraced garden that drops down towards the lobby, the atmosphere is one of cool calmness: neither overly trendy, nor stuffy or staid. The staff are friendly and helpful (especially the exceptional Concierge), the hot food acceptable (if not awe-inspiring), and the prices reasonable, if a tad expensive. But then it also gets so many little details frustratingly wrong: the worn and rough sheets, the extortionate internet (an extra €20/day for a wired connection; no wi-fi), the characterless bar and the lacklustre breakfast buffet; a general all-consuming impression that the hotel cold do with a minor spit-and-polish. No problem especially damning, but all frustrating, and all easily rectified. The question is: will they be?

Reviews.Title: “The most gorgeous interior gardens and rooms looking inward”
Reviews.Author: seriouslyours
Reviews.Content: This is the best , the most elegant , you get what you pay for but you won't forget the Russie Fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful haven in the city”
Reviews.Author: tamaramatravelbug
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel De Russie twice and will keep coming back again and again. Our first stay there in 2007 we took the second cheapest room and were given a room which had no outlook what so ever. So when we returned in 2009 we specifically requested a room with a view over the courtyard. Unfortunately there were none available so they upgraded us to a room with a private balcony over looking the Piazza. The rooms are a little tired and will need renovating soon however on the whole very spacious and clean. Its the hotel courtyard, restaurant and location that make this hotel one of the best in Rome. The restaurant serves the most delicious Italian breakfast and the waiters were divine. They even remembered us from our stay in 2007. With a little notice the concierge desk went above and beyond to make both of our stays in Rome wonderful. They organised a fabulous tour guide for a private tour of the sistine chapel and helped with shopping, restaurant bookings and a day trip to Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: hootie23
Reviews.Content: Expensive but fabulous with excellent food & service. Garden is a real treasure amidst the concrete jungle of the the city centre.Look for special offers & you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a short city trip”
Reviews.Author: genevazurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Rusie with my wife and two and a half year old son. The hotel was perfect. The rooms were nice, the service was great and the food was very good (a bit expensive). The hotel is in walking distance of the shopping district and a five minute taxi ride from the major historical attractions. There are many cafés and restaurants nearby. The concierge recommendations were not always on the mark. The only issue was with our son who didn't have much to do in Rome. We took him to the zoo which was not up to standard and which I wouldn't really recommend. We also went to the Medici park right near the hotel which was very nice. there is a carrousel for the kids. There is also a kids museum not too far which is ok for a few hours. All in all, it was a very nice stay, but three or four days would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and restaurant in a garden”
Reviews.Author: scenographe
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the center of Roma. Nice rooms, very nice back yard with a good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better than this?”
Reviews.Author: upgo
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms at this hotel and staff were not only friendly and helpful but truly incredible! They helped guide our visit with best places to visit, grab a bite, etc. The "happening" place was the bar! People packed the bar and the cosmopolitan I had was one of the best I have ever had. The room was larger than thought and a gift of chocolates was the most delicious goodie ever! I found I craved it once back in the US and the chef told me where they got them and how I could get them. All went the extra mile for us to have a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome (and possibly the world)”
Reviews.Author: peterhall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights in August with my young family and a group of friends. We had the most wonderful stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help me with some business communications. The restaurant staff were delightful and so kind to our 8 month old baby. Rooms were spotless and gorgeous. Will always stay in Rome at the Hotel de Russie - its location is superb and the hotel is the epitome of elegance and grace.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Offer Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AstrieWallerk
Reviews.Content: Rome is beautfull for a lot of thing and place, there are hotel in amazing place, this hotel is on street nothing special, in front of the entrance there is a 3 star hotel and next to the hotel popoulace building. the staff is very snobb the restaurant is without view the corridor is in vain big the room with nothing of special from the window of the room the view is on apartmanets house expensive and overpice

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - overpriced hotel, spotty staff and low quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: CurryA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the tail end of our Honeymoon and it was a major disappointment. I read some of the the negative reviews but overlooked them, but now that I have stayed there they were spot on. The bad experience started at check in - we asked to change rooms after our toilet wouldn't flush and my wife found a wet spot (hopefully just water) on the bed that was overlooked by housekeeping - which apparently had just cleaned the room prior to check in. They accommodated our request to change rooms and upgraded us to a nicer room, but it took about an hour and a lot of back and forth. When we got to the new room, there were scuff marks all over the room - it really needed a new coat of paint and it smelled moldy. The rooms are supposed to be "modern luxury" but they look like they're done with cheap furniture. The staff is really spotty, in the breakfast room, they were great. One of the concierges was very helpful, the other just was totally unhelpful and even slightly rude. Also, we got several different answers from the front desk as to when the breakfast buffet opened in the morning, I think it's 7AM, Finally when we checked out at 6:30AM neither of the elevators were working, so I had to walk down 4 flights of stairs with bags, and for some reason, they could not produce a copy of my bill when I asked for it at check out. I'd be wiling to overlook some of these shortcomings if this wasn't one of the most expensive hotels in Rome. Additonally, out of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our honeymoon in Italy, this was the only one that didn't have free wifi or internet access...the cost? 20 Euros for 24 hours, which should give you an idea of how things are run at this place.The only good thing about the hotel is it's location which is pretty central for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive...but it's Rome!”
Reviews.Author: haffinhaffaflap
Reviews.Content: We've been to Rome a few times and had varying success with hotels. Stayed in a lovely man's flat which he'd extended over a couple of floors, and I'd love to reccomend but I can't remember the name. Also stayed in the Eden, which I hated. All plush velvet and no heart. The Russie is very different. The location is ace. Steps away from the Piazza del Popolo (?!) and the Spanish Steps. Walking distance from the Trevi and much else. Shopping?? This is where you have to be. The hotel itself has a bit of a relaxed vibe and is set around a rather delightful courtyard, where you can sit for coffee, beer, cocktails etc. Or you can just sit. From the courtyard you can wander up toward the restaurant and beyond through some very pleasant greenery - though parts were closed off when we were there. The restaurant is lovely enough - and dinner was particularly memorable. The staff are also very relaxed and the concierge amazing. Service is...er...Italian, by which I mean that it can take a little while to get a drink. But hey...feeling frustrated? Go and ask them for the menu. They'll think you're a bit mad but they won't care a jot. The room we had was a regular double and beautifully appointed and the bathrooms lovely. I don't think there are any rooms with a view (unless you count the courtyard) but otherwise everything was lovely. Yes, the rooms are expensive. Yes, the drinks are expensive. But, without a shadow of a doubt the nicest hotel I've stayed in, in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: WillJen888
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Russie is in a perfect position, near everything. It has a wonderful "Roman Holiday" feel: The courtyard is perfect for breakfast, and the aquatic baths (note no pool) is a great place to relax after a hard day sightseeing. Pre dinner drinks at the hotel is a perfect start to the evening. Service was excellent and attentive. Rooms were a reasonable size - we had a technical issue in our first room (which was big), and were promptly moved to a smaller room, however this looked out on to the courtyard and was just perfect. The only downside is it is very expensive. Beware the tourist traps (i.e. cafes) close by to the hotel, and always seek a reccomendation from the concierge. Free internet in the business centre downstairs, but no wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Romatic and lovely”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchSheffield
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came here for a romantic few days and we were not disappointed. The courtyard is stunning and such a great place to enjoy a quiet drink before heading out to try a restaurant. It is also beautiful to have breakfast here too, if you are not having room service. The location is perfect, just far away enough from the madding crowds but close enough to be able to walk to some of the most famous ruins in the world. We had a brilliant time and look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TB07960
Reviews.Content: The service is amazing which made our 2 nights here so nice. Its a fairly modern hotel. Very pricey. Good place to stay if in Rome for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mlvc
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its reputation. The perfect place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wellness center 'watch' out!”
Reviews.Author: gugli
Reviews.Content: Went to get a massage between business appointments. Wonderful and the service was very courteous. Yet I got rid of my watch right before the massage and put it on my bathrobe pocket. Left it there and went on to my next business appointment to realize 20min later that it wasn't on my wrist anymore. Went back and it was gone. The cleaning lady explained to me very (and I mean Very) nervously that it wasn't there. I am as sure as it gets that I left it there. So, as they told me at the reception, make sure to always use their safe if you have valuables in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service at this over priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: avrammiller
Reviews.Content: We did not have a good experience at this hotel. Are room was ok but extremely expensive even by Italian standards for what we got. The key issue was the concierge staff. We book two restaurants through them in advance. We asked for both to be at 9:00 pm and got confirmation that we had these reservations. When we got to the hotel they told us that our first reservation as at 10:15 pm. We were on Turkish time (an hour later) and wanted to eat earlier especially after a day of travel. They could not get an earlier reservation and recommend a place like the one we reserved. They said it was only five minuets in a taxi. Well, the place was mediocre at best and was 15 minutes a way by taxi. We could not eat at the outside tables and were put in an inside table that had nothing but an empty room to look at. I think we paid more than $40 in taxi fairs. When we got back we took a bit of a walk and found some really nice restaurants close to the hotel. Prior to the dinner, we went to the garden bar which is in a very beautiful setting. All the tables were booked (probably by locals). We waited around and were finally given a table (not in a very good location). We gave our drink orders to the waiter. We ordered two cocktails and a bottle of water. After 30 minutes we still had no drinks. I asked the waiter about this and he said the bar was very busy but we saw another table that had arrived later then us get served. I asked that he bring the water at least now. He said yes but did nothing about it. We left with no drink after another 15 minutes The next night worked out. Then we were to leave by car and asked that they confirm our rental reservation. They confirmed it but then said we had to leave at 8:00 am that morning because of a bicycle tour that would prevent us from leaving the hotel later. It turned out that the tour had been rerouted the week before and this was totally not required. We had to leave two hours before we wanted to. We got to Avis to find that it was closed and had to stand in the street for another 30 minutes. In the mean time we had found out that there are many really nice boutique hotels in Rome. This place really sucks unless you want to play close to $100 for breakfast for two.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best luxury hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and then stayed on for the w/e with my partner. I usually prefer smaller non chain hotels but this was excellent. The staff were great, the room was upgraded, the gardens are lovely and the restaurant, terrace and bar are excellent. I like it for being quite pared down and not oppressively opulent or self consciously designed. It's not cheap and you would have to question whether you need to spend this much, but this is worth it more than most hotels of this price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and found the hotel very good. The staff were courteous and efficient and my room on the fifth floor was quiet and had everything you would expect in a five star hotel. I agree it is very expensive,not helped by the current dire exchange rate from sterling to euros ,however, the standard was high. The location is excellent.The main sights are all walkable unless it is pouring with rain.Also very close to the main shopping area and many restaurants. If, like me, you don't need a a 34 euro breakfast, there are cafes next door to have a cappuccino and croissant for alot less. The bar has a lovely outdoor courtyard with large umbrellas and patio heaters - comforable to sit out in even though it was in the January rain. A very good, top end base for sightseeing in Rome - if you are prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “De Russie Devine”
Reviews.Author: joycewt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure to stay with Forte Hotels in both Rome and Florence this past April. We purchased our 6 night hotel package on Luxurylink.com. Our package included 3 nights at the Savoy in Florence and 3 nights at the De Russie in Rome. It was an exceptional value considering the state of the euro vs the dollar at the time (04/08). To say we were thrilled with our accommodations at both 5 star hotels is an understatement. The De Russie in particular was stellar. The hotel is in a fabulous location. Steps away from major sights, the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of many fine restaurants and shops. Our spacious room featured a king sized bed, sitting area, oversized marble bathroom, luxurious bedding and tasteful decor. Clean lines, art, and fine furnishings made our stay so special. Our room was located on hotel's top floor, and overlooked the walls of the Borghese Gardens and the private outdoor garden/restaurant and terraces of the hotel. In a bustling city like Rome, this quiet and calm green oasis provided a relaxing haven. The view from our balcony was magnificent. The Hotel De Russie also features an excellent spa which features a lovely indoor heated and jetted pool. We booked massages and felt totally pampered. Our package included daily breakfast and a superb dinner at the Jardin De Russie. We dined al fresco by candlelight while being serenaded by soft live music. It was enchanting! The staff at the hotel was so helpful, the service meticulous and food amazing. We stay at lovely hotels everywhere we go, but this hotel in particular was the most exceptional one to date. Attention to detail, luxurious furnishings and the view to end all views..... I cannot wait for the opportunity to stay with the De Russie once again. This was our fourth time purchasing a Luxurylink auction package. All were winners, but this one was like winning the lottery!

Reviews.Title: “Only one observation; otherwise fabulous”
Reviews.Author: octavian_8
Reviews.Content: After a rotten experience with checking into to another hotel in Rome that we'd booked my wife and I agreed to leave that hotel and recover from the demoralising effect (see review of Hotel del Sole Al Pantheon) by staying here. My only quibble is that when I queried the price for a two night stay I was quoted the per night rate. As I soon discovered the hotel was more expensive than what I thought I was going to pay. But it was worth it. When you go into a hotel and see Hollywood star Colin Farrell sitting in the foyer you know you're in a decent hotel. The staff were TREMENDOUS and I wanted to hug them. The rooms were large and spacious. The bar is relaxing and the garden is amazing for a cramped city like Rome. The location is absolutely fantastic - in the middle of everything (check out the road parallel but running behind the street of the hotel for amazing shops and restaurants). This hotel rescued our holiday in Rome for which I am very grateful. But be careful getting quotes for the rates; they will quote you the per night rate even if you tell them how long you are staying

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: HRHalac
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel knowing in advance it was going to be a nice experience. I was in the last portion of a 10 day business trip to London, Paris and Rome and wanted to treat myself to a nice hotel centrally located in Rome. At 726 Euro per night, the price tag is well worth what you will save in headaches, long walks back to your hotel and what may be one of the most lavish experiences you will have. It was what I expected and then some. To begin, the location could not be better to walk around the old part of town, it is at the very edge of the Piazza della Repubblica, on Via del Babuino, one of the main shopping streets in Rome. This is the most expensive area to live in Rome, the hotel gardens and all the inside rooms face the gardens of the Palazzo Borghese, so the back drop is scenic. A short 5 minutes walk on the same Via del Babuino and you are at Piazza Spagna. Walk one block down and parallel to it is Via del Corso, another main shopping street. The hotel stay and the concierge personnel made up for the nightmare I was going through, my luggage did not arrive with me. I flew Alitalia from Paris and they lost both pieces. I am back in the US and there is still no news about it. The concierge personnel (Alessandra, you must say hi to her, she is just fantastic, and Giusseppe who had a great dining suggestion after another) did what they could to try and locate my luggage, which meant calls to Alitalia every couple of hours. I got upgraded to a great studio room facing the front of the building, room 510. Linen sheets, silk draperies in muted colors, authentic pieces of art and clean contemporary furniture with an ode to the 40's made the place an oasis, I did not want to leave that room. The bathroom all outfitted in white and grey marble with shining polished chrome fixtures has just the perfect size and perfect lighting. My room particularly was very quiet, even though it faced the street. Upon arrival I dined at the garden restaurant, quite pricey (90 Euro for one person, 2 glasses of Pinot Grigio) under the stars, lit by candles. It was so quiet you could barely hear the murmur of the conversations in the tables around. After a flight and what i was going through, it was exactly what i needed. The lobby and hallways are decorated with original engravings and sculptures placed strategically, the effect is both theatrical and inspiring, clean walls, clean floors devoid of rugs and 16 feet ceilings confirm you are walking into a historical building that had to be preserved at all costs. My check in process did not take more than 2 minutes, the check out process the same. Upon leaving I left a shirt to be laundered which the concierge staff sent back to me at home at no charge to me even though I had specified a courier account they could use. I will definitely make this my only place to stay in Rome, the level of service, the impeccable condition of the building, the halls and my room made for an unforgettable experience I want to bring my partner to share next time I visit this city.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible -- don't understand the complaints”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: This is a very distinctive property. The hotel feels like a modern Italian villa but is located in the heart of the city near the Spanish Steps. Staff are very attentive. The rooms are perhaps small for the price but are well furnished and the public areas are lovely. Food is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fintys
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Rocco Forte hotel and having seen the brochure and the website we were really excited at the prospect. We booked the third most expensive suite (Popolo) which overlooks the Piazza del Popolo and after all the hype, we were distinctly underwhelmed! So much so that when we were shown to our suite we had to ask if it was indeed the Popolo Suite! The modern decor was pleasant but all much smaller than we expected. The bathroom - far from being superior - was small with a shower within the bath, no separate shower!! Very poor. We suggest they take a look at the Spirit Suites at Gleneagles in Scotland if they want to know about superior bathrooms!! The roof terrace overlooking the Piazza was large and furnished with a table and chairs plus two recliners. However this lovely area could not be used during the heat of the day because there was no umbrella or awning to shelter one from the sun. We wanted to relax and read on this terrace and indeed have our breakfast there as shown on the website but it was not practical. (When breakfast did arrive it was on a trolley and there is no way that could have been lifted over a large step onto the terrace). When we asked for an umbrella we were told it would be done while we had lunch in the courtyard. However upon returning to our room after lunch nothing had been done. We contacted the desk only to be told that they could not put umbrellas on this terrace because it was on the city side of the hotel. This was the main reason for booking this suite so we could relax in private - a complete waste from every point of view! When we complained we were told nothing could be done but that the manager would arrange for an awning to be put up for guests in the future!! Great!! "The striking landscaped garden" - as quoted in the brochure is certainly an attractive area to dine and a calm oasis from the noise of the city outside but the umbrellas were filthy and birds landing on the tables were a big problem. The Secret Garden is very small with very few places to sit and read/relax and we didn't see a single butterfly!!?? Not value for money. A big disappointment. We will not go there again. Fintys

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Confused by the Bad Reviews...It Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: jrj50
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I'm confused by the "high end" hotels getting such bad reviews on this website, but my wife and I spent 2 nights at the Hotel de Russie in June 2008 and it was excellent. I guess if people are paying a ton of money, they expect zero problems and issues, but that's another topic. We were upgraded to a 1BR suite, which had views of the garden and a private outdoor terrace. The room was huge, with a small office as well as couches, etc. We didn't spend much time enjoying the hotel, but did hit the spa and breakfast, which were both excellent. The location is fantastic for shopping and near Spanish Steps, etc. We had dinner at La Rosetta and Cafe Riccoli, which were both excellent but pricey (Rosetta was recommended an Italian chef friend from here in NY, but I recognized others from our hotel, so I think it's on their list). Overall, the hotel was excellent, if expensive. I recommend it to anyone who's looking to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: mofat
Reviews.Content: First the positives points: Very nice garden where taking the breakfast is a real pleasure and .... That's it. Everything starts when the concierge forgot to sent us the private car at the airport, when we arrived at the desk (by taxis) we found that the swimming pool is out of order for renovating works . To apologize they proposed to give us the first room which will be ready and the will call me on my mobile. (I am still waiting the call) The rooms are very noisy (we were wake up during the night by our neighbour who goes to the bathroom) and the housekeeping was light. To finish, they offers us the transfers for the airport, but the concierge made (again!) a mistake and sent us in the wrong one.... Finally I will never go back again in this hotel and it is not worth the price paid and its 5 stars Luxe !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “4th return in 5 years”
Reviews.Author: roccofortefan
Reviews.Content: This summer was the 4th time we returned to Rome and the De Russie.We stayed 5 nights in a junior suite with the kids in a classic double next door. Were the carpets a little dated and worn? Yes, but have you ever stayed at the Eden? Not very different there. Overall,the De Russie is still an excellent choice for the spoiled Rome traveler and it is,like everything else in the eternal city,truly expensive. We simply love the location! The service is truly italian - hit with a couple misses but oh,so charming. This time we brought our 18 year old as well as 8 year old and everybody was just so lovely with the kids. The breakfast buffet is truly outstanding and seems to get better every year. Drinks at the courtyard bar were a wonderful experience even with the kids. Dinner outside is just so lovely and the food is very good. Then again,the adults had dinner at the best seafood restaurant in Rome - La Rosetta!! Same (terribly) high prices but the most wonderful and creative seafood we ever had anywhere. And the service - oh so GREAT! Overall,we still think the De Russie is the best bet for a traveler used to great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not superb”
Reviews.Author: efren
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a business trip (4 days) and it was good but not over the top. It is expensive, especially because of the weak dollar, and you don't get that much. The rooms are small, but nicely done. My room looked over the cafe/garden area, so that was fantastic. I personally prefer the decor of the hotel. It is not overly decorated like most European hotels and it tends to be more contemporary but elegant. The best part of this hotel is sitting in the outside bar and having a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Brownbreadnbutter
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to visit Rome for ages, and, therefore, I had thought about it all very carefully. The swanky palaces on the Via Veneto never appealed to me, and so the choice of accommodation came down to three Hotels, the Lord Byron, the Eden and the De Russie. I deleted the Lord Byron because, so it seemed to me, it was the wrong side of the Borghese Gardens to be convenient. I was right. I anguished about the choice between the Eden and the De Russie, but having stayed at the Savoy in Florence, I decided to trust Sir Rocco. All of this was arranged in January for a May stay, and so I had plenty of time to worry about the less than wholly enthusiastic reviews on trip advisor. I did worry, but I needn't have. We loved the hotel. I saw no sign at all of any neglect in maintenance. Everything seemed to be immaculate. Our room, which we had booked as a "deluxe" room [and we were told on arrival we were being "upgraded"] turned out to be an average size room but with a fabulous terrace [on the 6th floor] overlooking the Via del Babuino with views to the Piazza del Popolo. It was very nice indeed. Granted the decor in the public areas is "pared down" but that IS the style, and seemed to me, anyway, as being wholly appropriate to the building and location. There is just no doubt that eating in Le Jardin de Russie is a truly delightful experience, especially dinner, and as it gets dark. We did go to the Eden, dining in the roof top restaurant on one of our nights in Rome. We had a lovely dinner, but felt that that Hotel was a bit "old and cold and settled in it's ways". It would be delightful for an older clientele, but I reckon that the De Russie sums up what Rome is all about now. I definitely recommend it and would love to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in refinement, somehow...”
Reviews.Author: Claire88888
Reviews.Content: The room was very lovely, with a beautiful view, but this hotel was overpriced. It almost seemed like it was falsely advertised... The staff was sheepish when I innocently asked, "where's the butterfly garden?" The special butterfly garden didn't really exist -- there were no butterfies and that area of the garden wasn't particularly well-maintained... The indoor pool area in the spa was a bit claustrophobic -- It's not as elegant as it seems in the photos. I also noticed that the carpeting in the hallway stairs was worn and slightly dirty. This hotel advertises itself as one of the most glamorous hotels in Europe, and it isn't! There must be smaller hotels in Rome that are more elegant, interesting, and more reasonably priced. I was a 'young' woman travelling alone (31 yrs. old) and the slightly hostile waiter at breakfast (who wasn't Italian) teased me inappropriately -- to the point where a mature Scandanavian couple at the next table became a bit uncomfortable on my behalf. The breakfast was too expensive... It was impolite to charge so much for breakfast, and then to pester me so I couldn't enjoy the newspaper! Complimentary coffee and a modest breakfast should have been available in the lobby. This was a splurge, but I felt a little silly spending so much... It's a fancy hotel, but it's not really "of the highest caliber." Something about this place just didn't add up. I did notice that there were some trashy couples on romantic getaways & they seemed to be dazzled by the whole experience... My fellow Americans... Bleh. :P

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jakath
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a 3 night stay at the Hotel de Russie and it was superb. We stayed there 3 years ago and returned to find that the hotel is even better than before, the location could not be better and the staff are so helpful and ready to help with anything you may need. One of the highlights of the hotel is the beautiful garden which is a real oasis of calm in a very busy city. We loved the food and the room was lovely and overlooked the courtyard. We will return to Rome and this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but property has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Sejase
Reviews.Content: I stayed at de Russie for 4 nights together with my wife and I must say that the place did not quite live up to its five star reputation. The location is excellent but the property is not in particularly good shape relative to its peer group. Our room could've used some new paint and textiles- The same goes with the public areas of the hotel. Secondly, the service was polite but not top-notch. For example, they made several errors in preparing our bill and forgot to tell us that our driver had arrived to pick us up for the airport despite having specifically asked for that 30 min earlier. For a "normal" hotel the flaws would have been in some sense acceptable, especially taking into account the relaxed Italian approach to organising things, but with de Russie's prices things should have been in much better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Nice / satisfactory stay at de Russie”
Reviews.Author: mammel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to leaving for a cruise. We found the hotel service to be good (ie. satisfactory for this type of hotel). They assisted us with restaurant reservations, car service, etc. Our room was nice, overlooking the courtyard. It was a fairly standard room, and for European standards I did not find it to be small. The bathroom was very nice, and the room was quiet. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet and but did not enjoy lunch at the hotel as much. However, for the expense of the property, we've stayed at nicer, with better service. But the location is great, and we could walk all over, so I expect that is built into the price. We'd likely try a different hotel for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wt23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over Christmas and can't rave enough about this hotel. This is the perfect location and the service is amazing. The rooms are on the small side, but apparently most hotel rooms in Rome are on the small side. Our room was great, had a nice city view and a fabulous bathroom and shower. The staff was amazing and the concierges were more helpful than at any hotel I've ever been to. They gave us great recommendations for any questions we had. The Stravinskji Bar is a really hip place among Romans and tourists and the staff at the bar was incredibly friendly (somewhat surprising for such a hip spot) and remembered our drink orders every day. Free Internet in the business center was a nice surprise, too! We stopped by the Hassler for a drink and it was old and stuffy -- hotels on Via Veneto are slower paced and the other hotels we checked out had nothing on the de Russie. Will definitely be staying here next time I'm in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, could use a little restoring”
Reviews.Author: waterstone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Russie for two nights for a quick look at Rome before attending a business meeting. I booked a single room on the hotel website and got what I thought was a decent price, breakfast not included. I also asked for the hotel to send a car to the airport. The car was great--bigger than the one I had requested, but I thought the hotel had made a substitution on their own and gave it no further thought. The driver was pleasant and offered his own tips for what I should see in the city. I was a little bemused by the lobby, small, busy, and a bit run-down as it was. However, the desk staff were also very pleasant , upgraded me to a double room, and got me settled efficiently. The room was spacious enough but, aside from the bed, the décor looked a little second-hand. I suspect they were aiming for the "distressed" look featured in some design mags, but I didn't think the floor needed to be that way too. No complaints about the bathroom--large, marbled, chock-full of amenities and towels. The bed was very comfortable and featured a number of pillows. Everything was clean. The room rate included two bottles of mineral water per day. One major complaint concerns outside noise: My room must have been near an alley or kitchen unloading area, as early in the morning there was the sleep-disturbing clatter of someone trundling a cart of glassware down a sidewalk. I didn't bother telling the front desk. The hotel's public areas were neither notable nor worthy of condemnation. If the hotel hosts a spa or gym, I used neither. Contrary to another poster's opinion, I found the breakfast to be stupendous. All manner of cold meats, fish, cheeses, breads, pastries, fruit, juices, etc., etc. A silver pot of coffee left at my table. Cooked eggs for the asking. Prosecco ad lib! I gavaged myself in the morning and wasn't hungry again until evening, even after full days of walking. I have to think I got my EUR 30 worth. I didn't eat any other meal at the hotel so can't comment on the restaurants otherwise. The location on the Piazza del Popolo is an excellent starting point for sightseeing. There's a great deal of activity around the piazza itself, although at the time I was there it had some hideous reflective display sprawled through its middle. Not the fault of the hotel. On the bright side, I was able to walk from the hotel to Piazza San Pietro in one direction and to the Colosseum in another. Wandering through side streets, I found myself on one occasion at the Pantheon, then later at the Trevi fountain. I didn't have a great deal of interaction with the staff, though I did ask a concierge for a restaurant recommendation for traditional food. He was obliging though not particularly friendly, and his recommendation was just fine. At checkout, I was suprised to find a charge for more than double what I had expected for the airport transfer. I was charged the "limousine" rate (hence the larger car) though I had requested a sedan (and had the e-mail to prove it). The manager graciously declined to see the e-mail and simply charged the lower rate. All in all, I would recommend the hotel for its location (and for the buffet breakfast!). However--and only in my opinion--it isn't a true luxury property (even though it's prices might suggest that it is). I wouldn't pay more than about EUR 300 for a room here, unless I really, really wanted a suite, had to stay here regardless of cost, or had money to burn.

Reviews.Title: “Not really enthusiastic about the De Russie”
Reviews.Author: CedricΠerre
Reviews.Content: I was hesitating between the Hassler and the De Russie to come to Rome with my friend to celebrate his 36 birthday. I am happy with my choice but things could have been better. We stayed in room 214 which is a studio room facing Via del Babuino. We had made our reservation through Amex FHR Program but we were not lucky enough to be upgraded. 1) Location The Hotel de Russie is perfectly located near Plaza del Popolo. High end fashion stores are 200m away. In fact Rome is much smaller than I expected, and everything is easily accessible by walking. 2) Room & amenities The hotel is nice, but there is really nothing special. Hotels in Paris are on a totally different scale. I thought that may be the atmosphere of the De Russie would be close to the Park Hyatt Vendôme or the new Fouquet's Hotel on avenue George V, but you do not have the same "luxury" feeling. This is only a detail, but Christmas decorations for example are reduced to the minimum. I was expecting more. 3) Cleanliness The hotel is still in shape, but not in mint condition. And we found a toe nail on the floor. 4) Service This is the good point. Service is very good, from efficient and quick luggage delivery at check-in to perfect and complete turndown service.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, it's time for a facelift...”
Reviews.Author: chrisdiannefamily
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the hotel and our 3 night stay. Rocco de Forte hotels are favorites of mine. I have stayed at others which were much better. The hotel frankly is starting to look tired. The carpets are stained and in our room, Suite 301, the carpet had pulled away entirely from the wall. Generally, I agree with a previous post that says the walls are bashed here and there and the furniture is looking drab and faded. Additionally, the mosaic tile in our bath was disintegrating and pieces were in the shower each morning. I think an overall redo is in order! One concierge, a tall man (older than the others), was particularly rude. When we asked him about getting ice for our bottle of Proseco, he gave us directions to get it outside the hotel. He must have thought we were outsiders which is strange because we had asked him for directions to different things a number of times. After we identified that we were from the hotel, he said "From the bar.". The appropriate thing would have been to send it to us via Room Service. On a plus note, they did upgrade our room to a suite at no additional cost. One other concierge, a very nice woman, gave us great little places to try and she proved to be knowledgeable and eager to please by understanding our interests in food, etc. The hoteld did send us a bottle of Proseco because it was our wedding anniversary. That was a nice touch also but could have come as the result of my complaints in trying to reach them via email numerous times with no replies. The location of the hotel is great for shopping. The transfer to the airport was reasonably priced. But frankly for 621Euros, there are other places I could have gone. A disappointment for me. I love their hotels but it's time for a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment, not 5 star at all”
Reviews.Author: LEStraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a disappointment to us. We had booked it as this was our first trip to Rome and we wanted to to have a really luxurious hotel from which to explore the City. We enjoyed Rome despite, not because of, the hotel. I am sure that the celebrities staying at the hotel for the Film Festival the same weekend had a wonderful experience. However, the entire hotel is billed as (and charged as) 5 star and every room should live up to that standard as should the attitude of the concierge staff. We had emailed the concierge about 2 weeks prior to our arrival with a request for a dinner reservation at Dal Bolognese on the night we arrived. We only heard from them that this was not available on the late afternoon of our arrival and when we went downstairs to try to get another reservation we were scolded for our lack of preparation by the concierge on duty!! After that we tried to show them some suggestions that we had brought along from friends etc and these were sneered at. Grudgingly they agreed to make reservations at some of these (which were actually great) The small dark room that we were given in no way felt like a 5 star experience. We had not booked the cheapest room and in fact were told we had been upgraded (hard to believe). When we called to express our disappointment and explained that we had been expecting a "Garden or City view" we were told that travel agents often misrepresent the rooms to their clients..hmm but we booked it on your website!! One window looked directly across to the windows of an office building and the other, which was in a little annexe, looked onto an airshaft. We had to keep the lights on at all times. The carpet was stained and the furniture was chipped-not in an antique type of way but in a "need to replace this" type of way. In the last year we stayed at the Merrion in Dublin which I would imagine has similar contraints in terms of being an old building right in the center of town, it is extremely plush and luxurious. The Peninsula in Bangkok is the epitome of modern 5 star elegance and service. Hotel de Russie in no way measured up to either of these.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: natc143
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Russie offers upscale amenities, in room internet, fine dining, superior service and everything you'd expect from a five star hotel. The hotel is modern in decor, which was not particularly my style, however, it was in fact lovely. Le Jardin de Russie, the restaurant, was spectacular and Le Jardin (the garden) was magnificent. The location, just north of the Spanish Steps is ideal surrounded by the best shopping in Rome. Most sites are walking distance or a very short cab ride away. It was hot in August as we expected although we were quite comfortable most of our days. We booked a late August stay including breakfast, which was very convenient, since the American breakfast would exceed e100 per couple had it not been included. Our classic room was a bit small; however our rate was quite affordable (all things considered). The bathroom was lovely and spacious; however, I found the actual bathtub to be narrow. Room service would arrive within twenty minutes. Concierge was helpful and all the staff was wonderful. Upon arriving at De Russie we received a delicious chocolate mousse birthday cake in our room. It was delicious and extremely thoughtful! Nothing goes unnoticed in this fine hotel. I’ve stayed in numerous fine hotels in Italy and in the U.S. this was very good in comparison. Hotel Hassler was just lovely and I’ve heard both the St. Regis and Hilton are the top TWO HOTELS in Rome. Hilton is a bit further away though. I would definitely consider returning to Hotel De Russie in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dull and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SpaceHopperSussex
Reviews.Content: Strange place this. Very stark - yes it is supposed to be 'minimal' but just doesn’t work particularly well, frankly its boring. Biggest problem however is that it is worn out, pretty bashed up around the edges. Tables, chairs, sofas shabby. Stained carpets throughout. Another feature is the spa, however Turkish bath out of order when we arrived. Hotel makes a big play on its garden, which in theory is very nice, but when we visited was generally scruffy and unkempt. At breakfast there were gardeners weaving through the tables carrying a variety of garden implements. Paid 28 euros for two tiny glasses of orange juice and two coffees, thought that this was far too much. Fine in the George V as that is an outstanding hotel, the de Russie is far from this, even though it likes to think it is great. In saying all this at least service was generally good from the waiting staff/bar/front desk etc. Have been to other Rocco Forte establishments and they are much better. The de Russie are trying to trade on something which they just do not really have, so are going to find that hard to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Challenger007
Reviews.Content: Certainly one of Italy's top hotels and a perfect location from which to shop and tour Rome. The room was very cheerful and elegant with a huge walk-in type double sided closet, large bathroom with separate tub and shower, a small living room with sofa, tele, writing desk, chairs etc. and a spacious bedroom with a second desk, comfortable chair and additional tele. The living and bedrooms had large french doors overlooking the city and ajoining terrace with table and chairs. A lovely bottle of prosecco and perfect plums greeted our arrival. The concierge staff was truly outstanding and managed to secure dinner reservations at some of the finest restaurants in the world! Another find was a small family restaurant about a two minute walk from the hotel (Hostaria da Pietro). We enjoyed spag and clams, some amazing wine and not a tourist in site. The Hotel wanted us to stay nearby on this particular evening because it was White Night and impossible to get around the city. The food at the Hotel is quite good and the service impeccable. It was nice being acknowledged and welcomed by the doormen and staff in such a sincere manner. Back to the amazing Concierge('s) who located a helicopter on extremely short notice because our pre-arranged flight had been cancelled at the last minute. The laundry services and any special request was handled beautifully. Wonderful staff! Wonderful Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star”
Reviews.Author: lozza21
Reviews.Content: Looked at the reviews on this site and it lived up to them all, a 5 start hotel worth its start plus one more. Had a Classic which had a small problem the next morning got full upgrade to a deluxe with a garden view and breakfast was thrown in. The staff wre helpful all the way to bring me a unbrella when I got stuck in the rain. I would to Roma just for this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “highly expensive for average room”
Reviews.Author: Goldiemaciver
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked an expensive room in this hotel as a special New Year's Eve treat, looking forward to a glass of prosecco overlooking the city or garden views. The hotel itself is very grand and very beautiful, the gardens are lovely. The room itself was immaculate, clean and spacious. Unfortunately no city or garden view, just a roof. For 800 euros a night we expected something so much grander with at least a view, not of the roof. Also to pay this rate and then have to pay on top 20 euros for internet seemed a bit much. Don't expect too much for 800 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: UK-Travel-Bugs
Reviews.Content: Having spent 3 nights in the hotel, we left with mixed emotions. Without question, the staff are friendly and keen to help. This includes returning a plate of food to the kitchen 4 times and then not carging for a sizeable drinking session at the bar to appologise for the mix up. Well done to the hotel for managing this pretty well. The location is reasonable, with most of the key attractions being a 30 minute stroll through the shopping district from the hotel. On the negative side, well the rooms were just not really five star. Our carpets were dirty and stained. Most infuriating was the fact that our bed was next to the toilet of the adjacent room, which means that we woke a few times a night to the sound of someone either using or flushing a toilet a few feet from our heads Avoid room 402 at all costs. I could go on about the dirty shower curtain, or poor quality linen, but really it boils down to an attempt to put a five star hotel in a three star building. Still, in short, we returned home having enjoyed Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jillybeansan
Reviews.Content: Apparently the Hotel de Russie is the place to stay in Rome as there were famous people galore staying at the hotel while we were there for two nights in April. The hotel is certainly distinguished, but a bit worn around the edges. The carpet in our hallway and in our rooms was horrible. The stafff were extremely courteous and we were able to use the internet in the business center for free. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special. The location, of course, is near to perfect. However, we may check out a different place the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “From the outside looking in”
Reviews.Author: Saturday
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and stayed at the Intercontinental. (See Intercon for full review). Heard de Russie was very nice so popped in one night for a cocktail in their lovely garden. Well, we received better service during the one hour we spent there having cocktails than we received all week at our hotel. How pathetic. Thus encouraged, we returned the next day to ask the concierge for help with restaurant recommendations & reservations. Even though we weren't guests, the concierge was very gracious and helpful. I was appreciative and impressed by this - this is a sign of true professionalism & hospitality in my opinion. Obviously I can't speak about the rooms, but based on what I saw of the lobby, lounge, garden, bar, shops, restrooms, etc. I would say this is the place I would stay next time. Typically we check out hotels to see where we want to stay on next trip unless we are absolutely thrilled w/where we are staying. We checked Exedra, Inghliterra, St. Regis, Eden, & Mascagni. Hotel de Russie looked best.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class De Russie”
Reviews.Author: Classy II
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in to the Hotel De Russie for three nights and found the staff to be friendly and professional. I needed a room with a bath that would accomodate my bad hip and they came up with ideal room. We booked thru Luxury Link and were treated exceptionally. The hotel was spotless and the courtyard very inviting for dining and libations through out the day and evening.We used the spa and found it to be 1st rate and maintained impecably. At dinner, on our first night, a temporary bridge in my mouth came out while enjoying a wonderful piece of proscuitto.I went to the conceirge the next morning and I was immediately on my way the the dentist they had phoned. I was back in an hour. We dined at the Le Jardin restaurant in the hotel and had a magnificent meal. I have stayed at many top properties and rank the De Russie in the upper tier. My next visit to Rome will include a stay at the De Russie.

Reviews.Title: “De Russie very formal, poor location, not child friendly”
Reviews.Author: TVJ
Reviews.Content: After looking forward for several months to our stay at "the" Rome hotel we were sorely disappointed. The hotel is very stark, business like, with a formal air. We were charged over $100 Euros per night for our child to have a rollaway bed in the room. The room we up graded to (for 258 eruos per night) was lovely, comfortable, and well kept by housekeeping but not worth the additional $350 dollars per night. The bar is sterile and without any personality, It is a pretty fair walk to anything of any sighseeing value. We poked our head in many four star hotels that that had roof top gardens, friendly staff and seemed much more family friendly. You can do better for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: PabsKuch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at Hotel De Russie. Great location and property, the gardens are a nice escape from the crowded city. Very nice and friendly staff , ready to accommodate any wish, from the concierge desk to the housekeeping service. The bar and tables outside in the patio are a great place to relax and have a coffee or a drink. The rooms very well appointed and comfortable. The wellness Spa a very inviting and relaxing place to either have a treatment or use the Saunas, the pool and the fitness room. We stayed at many 5 star hotels in different parts of the world and this one is at the top of our list. Overall a very classy and refined place without all the superficial glitz.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: GMasterGeneral
Reviews.Content: We live just outside Rome and decided to treat ourselves to New Year in one of Rome's reputedly best hotels. We chose the De Russie because of its location near Piazza Del Popolo, supposed centre of Roman New Year, and because we would be assured somewhere to drink given the sparcity of decent (i.e. that don't resemble transport cafes) drinking holes in the Eternal City. Come the big night, venturing outside was like entering a war zone: kids throwing fireworks, kids throwing bottles, and as a variation on a theme, kids throwing fireworks in bottles. The party having moved to another Piazza across town, the Piazza Del Popolo was a no-go zone. The big surprise then was on returning to the safety of our hotel, where we found that in addition to the dining room being booked out to guests paying 800 euros each for a gala evening, the bar too was all booked up and full of suits. So we suffered the indignity of being ejected from our own bar, while visitors got preferential treatment. Needless to say, the hotel staff couldn't care less. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, gorgeous and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: RLJUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel combines cool style with a genuinely warm service. If you like your interior design classical and sleek rather than baroque and cluttered, you will love the Hotel de Russie. The staff are very efficient and keen to help you enjoy your stay however they can - the housekeeping staff are like a SWOT team descending on your room every time you leave, the concierges and front desk people manage to make what could be a rather imposing environment perfectly relaxing and the restaurant staff are efficient and welcoming. The garden makes this hotel very special even without the carefully thought out interiors and the super service. Yes its expensive, but you get value for all that money! I went for a romantic weekend, and really couldn't fault the whole experience. A perfect retreat from the bustle of the city streets whilst keeping a uniquely Roman flavour.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic?”
Reviews.Author: sweetpoppi
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at The Russie in Rome. When I first checked in I was given a very small room however, after I complained I was given another room which was larger and beautiful. The staff and concierge at his hotel are among the best, professional, courteous and very accomodating the utmost in service. However, I found the hotel to be in need of a little work as it was 'in places' shabby around the edges and felt a little cold. Do not venture into the spa, it's disgusting!!! Almost like an old Victorian baths with tiles missing and an awful smell of mildew. The 'bath' 'jacuzzi' is cold and the steam room just awful. On the other hand do get a treatment, staff are wondeful, great prices (compared with other hotels) and complete value for money. The bar area I also found to be a bit awkward, it wasn't really inviting or cozy more like a kitchen. Anyway, at 15 Euros for a Bacardi/coke and 22 Euros for a 'sweet wine' save your money. Do visit the little restaurant across the street 'Il Brillo Parlante' great food, excellent prices and popular with the locals-always a good sign. I did stop in on a day visit at the sister property of The Russie, The Savoy in Florence which was much more appealing, inviting and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DuffCooperJr
Reviews.Content: This hotel marks the begining of my adventures with a very special lady. We chose to meet in Rome this past October, and after numerous searches on the web and tripadvisor we settled on the Russie. It is in an old villa with an enclosed center court yard, near the spanish steps. We had arranged for the hotel to pick us up at the airport, but our flight was delayed for over an hour, and upon clearing immigration, the car had left. While a little dissapointing, we made our way to the taxi que and headed for the hotel. Upon arrival we were quickly checked in an led up to our 2nd floor suite facing the main road. The room itself was very spacious, high ceilings, a very large and comfortable bed, and a sofa with armchairs off to the side. The bathroom was fairly large with a sunken tub with shower. The room had internet access, a well stocked mini bar and a bottle of wine waiting for us. We quickly freshened up and set off finding a place to eat. We checked with the concierge for a recommendation for dinner, he made reservations at a nearby restaurant and we were off. The weather was beautiful and after walking our dinner off, we returned to our room. We opened the windows in our room, and since our room was so close to the street it was just too noisy to leave them open. The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the major sights in Rome and there is some fairly nice shopping areas as well. On our last night we had dinner in the terraced courtyard of the hotel. It was beautifully lit by candlelight, and a small band was playing..the food was wonderful, the company even better. Would we return to the Russie, I believe so, but on our next trip we will get a room on a higher floor, off the street, preferably facing the interior terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury , Luxury , Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bspoll
Reviews.Content: Greatest Hotel I've stayed in , there , I've said it. I have stayed in 5 stars all over the world but this place will take some beating. THe room was enormous , the drinks were fantastic , the food - beautiful and the the staff and location were the best we could have imagined . Book a room now and see what hotels should be like

Reviews.Title: “Losing Its Polish!”
Reviews.Author: N827CA
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival was given a room which had soiled walls, a chipped tub and spots on the marble floor around the toilet that appeared to be urine stains. Not a great way to start. Hotel sought to charge me 100 Euros per night more than the agreed upon rate negotiated by Amex. Breakfast on the terrace: beautiful, lush setting with very average service (mixup with the decaf vs regular coffee, no silverware provided for the coffee, an odor of beer/garbage by the first table provided, etc.) Overall: great location, spacious rooms (by European standards) with even more spacious baths by EU standards. However, the polish is clearly missing from the service and the common areas need attention (simple maintenance, painting, carpet cleaning etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Wahou...excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIXSQUARED
Reviews.Content: All is about expectation and at Hotel de Russie we get even more than what yopu expected. The location is perfect in the heart of the shopping district of Rome. The room is spacious well decorated as all the hotel. The hotel is well manage and the staff very helfull. The concierge provide us with excellent recommandation for restaurant. We had a small probleme which as been resolved with style. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in the wordl”
Reviews.Author: marybRiverside
Reviews.Content: My family has been to Rome many times, but this was our first time at the De Russie. It will not be our last. It's indescribably beautiful, a calm oasis with the frentic Piazza del Popolo steps away. The concierges made it an unforgettable trip: a private tour of the Vatican (imagine being in the Sistine Chapel with only 6 other people!), wrangling dinner reservations to hot spots and hidden osteria...a weirdly Italian spa and gym (no one actually swims or exercises other than Americans). Just amazing. The rooms were deco-period luxe with everything that you could expect and want. If only I could spend a week here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Another Rocco Forte Success”
Reviews.Author: ARDNAHOE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first time while taking a long weekend away from our kids and work. We had a great time in a very pleasant, prettily decorated and (blissfully for very central Roma) quiet room backing onto the hotel gardens and Trinita dei Monti. This is a grand old lady of Roman hotels who has been through a fair degree of buffing up and some decorative Botox. Service was good though room service admittedly was pleasant but not to US standards. The concierges and front-desk staff were superb. We were recommended a series of great restaurants within walking distance - all on the button and which met exactly our requirements ranging from the night we wanted a swanky, traditional Roman meal to the night we wanted a lighter, trendier tapas type wine bar! Many thanks for the recommendations. Our airport transfer was also arranged via the hotel. The spa is a bit of a disappointment - you cannot really get a proper swim but it is still pleasant for a dip after a day trekking the sights. The Bar is very popular with local business people and can get crowded but the waiters are pretty attentive and make sure residents get seated. Coffees and drinks are much pricier than locally -but hey you're paying to people watch too - we popped across the street for espressos and breakfast. The complimentary umbrellas from the doormen were much welcomed during some downpours - as was their ability to flag down cabs while everyone in Rome wanted one. WE WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality + perfect location, but....”
Reviews.Author: happa00
Reviews.Content: Arrivng at the du Russie with a scheduled airport pickup is 140 Euro one way, when arranged through the concierge. However one you sit in the Mercedes Minivan, you will find a small broshure of the subcontrator, that tell you the oneway is 60 Euros. Nice Markup... One you stepped inside that quite hideaway right at the piazza du popolo, you are welcomed very personally and checked in by an receptionalist in your room or suite. Try to get a room or suite that faced the garden, as all street rooms may be a but loed when you are used to sleep with open windows. Rooms are all spacious and clean, bathrooms and walkin closet are high standard. With a price of 980 Euro a night for the deluxe room, you may expect the spa - fitness access and internet included; not at the du rossie, where they charge you 11 Euros per fitness and 20 Euros per 24 hours (single MAC adress) internet access. Try the breakfast in the beautiful gardens, that is buffet style and of very high quality. We do not recommend the restaurant of lunch or dinner. For both occasions the same menue cards and not very creative food. You better want to go just a view steps to an nice italien restaurant. For dinner most concierge recommendations were not "inside" at all. Stay with your restaurant guide and book for the in places way in advance from home.

Reviews.Title: “chic and expensive”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at hotel de rusie. Pros: beautiful hotel with larger than average size rooms excellent location 15 minutes from the center 30 minutes from colloseum and vatican. high end shops within five minutes of the hotel spa, gym and pool on the premises piano and garden are lovely pleasant staff helpful concierge with good restaurant recommendations excellent breakfast buffet included with your room if you choose Cons: expensive at this time of year 600-1100 euro(720-2500)dollars felt like a very high end chain hotel the customer service was not consistent most of the staff were very nice but some people seemed haughty. I would stay there again if I got a good deal on the room rate. I would consider the hassler or eden or view at the spanish steps just to see if their customer service was more attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A chic hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Russie is a very chic hotel in an excellent location. The staff, including the concierge were extremely helpful and gracious. Also, the delicious breakfast buffet is served in a beautiful room. In the warmer months, there is a gorgeous terrace.

Reviews.Title: “POOR service,AVERAGE rooms, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel de RUSSIE between 8-15 feb 2006. The highest qualification I can give to this hotel is AVERAGE. After i`ve seen that de Russie is the highest ranked hotel in Rome by Conde Nast I didn`t hesitate to book it for my Valentine`s Day trip, I must say that now I regret my choice. We had a deluxe room that had a very good size and an uninspired contemporary design. The bathroom was kind of small and nothing impressive, it didn`t have a walk in shower, only a tub. The service is very poor, beggining with the doormen who didn`t bother to open the door for the hotel guests and when he did he kept talking on his cellphone, the waiters at breakfast who kept forgeting asking us what we want to drink and the concierge who made only bad restaurant suggestions sending us only where he probably had an agreement with the owners. All the staff, excluding the bar, had a rude and superiour behavior that I didn`t expect to find in such an expensive hotel.In my humble opinion the only good things are the location, the bar and the inner courtyard that i think in spring and summertime must be beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Finest”
Reviews.Author: AmoItalia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Rome, from 3 to 5 star, and The Russie was the first one that was flawless. I checked out of the Intercontinental, when I'd had enough of the inconsistant service there, and I hauled my bags down to The Russie. When I called to inquire about availability, I was quickly impressed when the reservations manager offered me a wonderfully reduced rate. I'm affraid that if I were to have been offered a rack rate I would have had to find other accomodations. However, my reduced rate, to my amazement, in no way changed the level of service that was given to me. When I checked in (at only 11:00am), the desk agent, Michaela, not only apologized for my room not being ready, she escorted me to the the beautiful hotel bar and insisted that I order anything I like (on the hotel of course), then she said that she would return for me just as soon as my room was ready. She did, in less than an hour, still apologizing for the wait, and took me to a gorgeous studio room with a view of Piazza del Popolo. It was incredible! It had beautiful stained wood floors, sky high ceilings, a huge mosaic tile bathroom, and furnished with impecable taste. The sheets on the bed (linen and smelling devine!) made it hard to get up in the morning, even knowing that Rome was outside! Everyone without exception that I came into contact with at hotel was wonderful. Room service, housekeeping, concierge, etc... It was so nice to return to the hotel and actually be greeted by name from the doorman! Truly worthy of all 5 stars in this hotel's rating.

Reviews.Title: “waist of money”
Reviews.Author: fozol
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for five nights and I do agree with the last review I think they do treat you very poorly if you dont follow their recomendations and I will not recommend to stay here in the future...

Reviews.Title: “25 euro for breakfast???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
